text:
Rami Rami is drinking a Hibernation Ale by Great Divide Brewing Company at Powi≈õle

Dziwne, orzechowo-karmelowo-drewniano-slodkie. Dosc lepkie i pelne. Dosc ciezkie w odbiorze. Acz ewidentnie fajne

Dark amber orange robe.
Nose of caramel and flowers, quite refined.
No bubbles.
Light body.
Refined palate on caramel and malt and something else, can¬ít say what.
Bit of bitterness on the finish.
Both refined, complex and a bit shy, would have expected some more actute aromas/notes.

Piana drobna trwa≈Ça, zdobi szklo. Kolor bursztyn wpadajƒÖcy w czerwien klarowny. Aromat, karmel, melanoidyny, suszone owoce, przyjemny. Smak Podobnie jest karmel, ciemne s≈Çody, melanoidyny, owoce suszone, wyra≈∫ne chmielenie. Piwo pe≈Çne nie s≈Çodkie, szorstkie z wysokƒÖ lekko piolunowa goryczkƒÖ. Piwo z≈Ço≈ºone, smaki grajƒÖ, Klasyk, Bardzo dobre.

Can from Beergium. Aroma is dark malt, surprisingly potent coffee, caramel, cocoa, dark bread, nut, some toffee, chocolate, with a slight hoppy touch. Flavour is medium sweet and bitter. Body is above medium. Rich with plenty of coffee and cocoa, tasty stuff.

Zapach ≈õrednio intensywny, karmel, toffi, orzechy laskowe, zio≈Ça, chleb, suszone owoce. Kolor brƒÖzowy, klarowne. Piana be≈ºowa, ≈õrednio obfita, drobna, ≈õrednio trwa≈Ça, lekki lacing. W smaku umiarkowana s≈Çodycz, ≈õrednia pe≈Çnia, karmel, chleb, zio≈Ça, cukier, orzechy. Goryczka ≈õrednia, wysycenie niskie.
Pours a caramel brown, sickly sweet aroma of caramel and malts, medium mouthfeel, taste of malts and caramel to match the aroma, tap.

Piana drobna, ≈õrednio obfita, ≈õrednio trwa≈Ça. Barwa brƒÖzowa, klarowna. W aromacie karmel, suszone owoce, orzechy laskowe, czarna herbata. Ma≈Ço intensywny. W smaku p√≥≈Çs≈Çodkie, paleta dok≈Çadnie taka sama jak w zapachu, ≈õrednia, herbaciana goryczka, niskie do ≈õredniego, drobne wysycenie, ≈Çadnie schowany alkohol. Po ogrzaniu lekkie mase≈Çko. W odbiorze nieco szorstkie, delikatnie lepkie, nie≈∫le pijalne.

Klasyczne angielskie ciemne piwo, bez historii i ekscytacji.

Aroma - something like brown ale. Not very rich, rather empty, nothing special.
Very nice ruby color. Bitterness is OK, maybe a very little alcoholic in aftertaste. Some notes of nuts, some notes of malts. Head is fine, small bubbles. Beer is rather watery.
Average at all.

12 fl.oz can. Pours clear dark reddish brown colour with a huge good lasting beige head. Aroma of roasted dark caramelish malt, quite nutty and breadish. Taste of sweet roasted malt, caramel, some spices, bread, vanilla, quite nice!

355ml can at home. Dark amber with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with nice subtle bitter tones. Caramel, malts, brown sugar, ripe fruits and hops. OK brew.
Pours brown opalescent, medium head. Dry fruits, malts, roasty, herbs, coffe. Strong herbal bitterness, some sweetness. Full body, somehow thin, average carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Can. Ruby color with beige head. Aroma is toffee, raisins, malty, caramel, herbal, berries. Taste is the same, with some spices and juniper, a bit sugary. Warming bitter finish. Soft silky mouthfeel. Very nice!

Can. Pretty dark ruby with a hint of hazy, creamy brown head. Grass, minerally dry berry/port, light cocoa. Medium full body, dry cocoa powder on the palate, dry earthy minerallic, crystal/caramel malt - a bit sugary, bisquit malt, good range of earthy and herbal hop notes. Berry tart finish with a side of chocolate.

33cl can from beergium. Appearance is light cloudy red brown black. Thin beige head. Medium bitterness, medium sweetness. Medium body, smooth carbonation. Aroma and flavour is caramel, roasted apples, vanilla, chili, juniper, roasted.

W aromacie poczƒÖtkowo piƒôkne kaka≈Çko podrasowane chlebowo≈õciƒÖ i karmelem, po czasie wszystko ga≈õnie, zostaje najwiƒôcej karmelu i pojawia siƒô ≈ºelazo. W smaku podobnie, pierwszy ≈Çyk to kakao z mlekiem, przypieczony chleb, potem tylko gorzej, wiƒôcej karmelu, lekkie ≈ºelazo, spora zio≈Çowa goryczka. Nie wiem co jest. Potencja≈Ç to piwo ma na znacznie wy≈ºszƒÖ ocenƒô.

Clear dark ruby and brown with neat beige head. Neat char with coffee, chocolate, herbs. Coffee, chocolate, bitterness of old coffee, nuts, just a hint of alcohol. Slick slightly watery palate with medium body. Long herbal and bitter finish. Winter is almost gone and this is to it¬ís memory.

(Great Divide Hibernation Ale) Can 355ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 8.7%
Deep mahogany brown colour on the body, clear, tall and thick tan head on top with good retention.
Aroma of caramel and toffee, toasted malts, hints of chocolate.
Taste is lightly sweet at first, then a nice bitterness follows, with toasted malts, caramel and toffee, bitter chocolate.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Pretty good.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2017 The Breadmaster and fescher Kaffeefeger zwischen Bohne und Satz üòâ. Hinter der R√∂stwand, kommen auch noch holzige spicey Notes zum tragen und sp√§testens im Mund sind dann auch die s√§uerlichen Redberryverweise da. Bei der Benetzung kommen ebenfalls kr√§ftig britische Earthw√ºrzhopflavours hinzu und lassen das dicke Ges√∂ff durchaus auch prickelnd fresh wirken. Applaus!!! Komplex, aber am Ende doch etwas zu kaffeedominant. 355ml CAN von BIERVANA M√ºnchen.

Can at home. Pours a clear dark brown/amber with a small off-white head. Aroma has both dark and milk chocolate, caramel, very bready malts, allspice, old coffee. Over medium sweet, under medium bitter. Medium body, low carbonation.

Hazy dark red color with a bit of tan head. Aroma has dark malt with a hint of coffee and a light spicy note. Taste is slightly fruity and spicy at first, caramel malt underneath, finishes with some green coffee beans and a light bitterness. Medium body, medium to low carbonation. Quite nice overall, malty but with a broad range of flavors.

0.33 bottle. Pours dark amber, with a creamy head. Nose is intense, rich malts and caramel. Taste is sweet and spicy, with pepper being the standout. Liquorish and hearty, it has that nice winter feel. Raising, dark fruits in the flavors. Enjoyed this thoroughly.
On tap at Biercab. Brown colour with dense beige head. Floral aroma. Sweet, caramel, sugar, floral and pastry taste. Medium body.

0.355 l can from ¬íBierPost.com¬í, canned in October 2016. Clear, very dark ruby with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, beige head. Sweetish, malty, slightly roasty aroma of caramel, dark honey, toasted nuts and some chocolate. Very sweet, malty and slightly roasty taste of milk chocolate, caramel, hazelnut, vanilla and a touch of dark fruits, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, slightly roasty and a bit warming finish. Medium to full body, slightly creamy and a little effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice with a surprising flavour profile. Tastes more like a Porter than like what I am used to from other Old Ales so far, and even the colour promised for more dark fruits. No complaints though, very pleasant overall.

355 ml. can. Canned 27 OCT 2016. Consumed @ Gollem. Very dark ruby brown amber, creamy tanned head. Nose is cacao powder & some lightly metallic herbal cough syrup, cacao instant mix, sugar, leaves + cocoa puffs. Tastes like powdery cocoa puffs mixed with lightly copper tasting cough syrup, cough syrup is lower than the rest, almost metallic, herbal, industrial caramel, leaves, sugar,... Body is same industrial near metallic cough syrup with grainy cocoa puffs dominating, if only less cough syrup + some metallic notes but overlal quite nice, interesting. Certainly enjoyed quite a bit.

Llauna de Biercab Shop. Cervesa color marr√≥ fosc amb bona escuma color beix. Aromes torrats de brioix molt fet. Llarga i equilibrada, digestiva. Cos mig-alt una mica viscos, carbonataci√≥ mitja-baixa. Molt bona!
335ml bottle from Alko, Viikki. Brilliant brew all around, reminds me of saying: ¬ìThe few who do are the envy of the many who watch.¬î - Jim Rohn. Excellent!

Color marrone con riflessi ambra, abbastanza limpida. Schiuma di media persistenza beige, vaporosa. Aroma di malto, caramello, melassa, frutta secca. Anche al palato risalta oltre queste note dolci, birra scorrevole ma con un bel corpo. Carbonazione media molto giusta. Alcol ben presente. Old Ale davvero ben fatta.

Mahag√≥ni sz√≠n≈± teste √©s a r√°teleped≈ë kr√©mes, ragacsos habja angolosan kr√©taporos, k√©ksajtos, √©desk√©sen nemespen√©szes, marcip√°nos sz√≠nezet≈± illatokat rejt. √çzvil√°ga k√∂v√©rk√©s mal√°tajegyek sokas√°ga, melyek m√©zes-karamell√°s, p√∂rk√∂lt k√∂nt√∂sben sorakoznak, cs√∫sz√≥san keserny√©s lenyomatot hagynak, s sz√°raz, de tartalmas levezet√©ssel b√∫cs√∫znak.

At Chappies social house. In a snifter. Pours dark purple with no head. Initial taste of sweet chocolate and coffee. Dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Can. Muddy brown with an average beige head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is brown sugar, molasses, raisins, toffee, and dark stone fruit. Taste is oak, vanilla, molasses, raisin, dark stone fruits, and pine bitterness. Average thickness and a little more carbonated than I would like.

Dark copper color with minimal light beige head and clear liquid. Medium/strong, balanced taste with dry fruits, malty bourbon, some vanilla and a hint of coffee. Nice combination soft bitterness. Wide taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with malts, dry fruits and some alcohol. Medium/light body with medium/light carbonation. Overall, stylish and high quality. Could have more intense taste though.
Half pint @ O¬íConnor¬ís, Uppsala. Exciting ale, complex aroma, somewhat burnt. Warming, cosy, not brutal.
330 ml bottle. Clear copper with off white head. Ripe fruit, dried fruit and malty biscuits. Semi dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with large beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee and a hint of fruit. Taste has roasted malts, caramel and a hint of booze.

TAP. Ruby pour with thick froffy head..
Coffee & biscuit/toffee malt nose..
Like the aroma, good toffee & biscuit malt base, goes to coffee & chocolate finish.. sourced great divide

Jordigt √∂rtartad doft med m√∂rka torkade frukter och en fruktig malt.
Djupt rubinr√∂d f√§rg och ett varaktigt skum. Rostad malt i smaken och den jordiga karakt√§ren g√•r igen, men nu tillsammans med aning alkohol och lite kakao.
Fyllig kropp och kolsyra i √∂verkant.
I eftersmaken v√§rmer en alkohol tillsammans med en framv√§xande mjukt balanserad beska.

Dark brown-reddish color with minimal beige head. Nice aroma of fruits and caramel mixed with pine. Taste is malty, combined with fruits, caramel and hops. Nice alcohol warmth in the end. Overall an excellent winter-warmer beer !

Bottle. Pours clear brown to amber with low head. Aroma is burnt popcorn, chocolate, roasted malts. Flavour is dark fruits like prune, alcohol, roasted malts, and some fresh herbs like mint or something.

Beautiful clear brown pour with hints of amber. Lasting beige pillow of one finger that laces all the way down. Aromas are of cooked sugar, roasted malts and darkest chocolate. Slight prune/raisin and some booze are noticed in the nose as it warms. Flavors are very similar with the only somewhat disappointing aspect being a bitterness that develops over the course of the beer and lingers without being assuaged by the next sip. Very smooth stuff too. If this were slightly sweeter, especially in the finish I¬íd be in love.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 Flaska systembolaget. Svartbrun kul√∂r. Tydlig rostad doft med m√∂rk sirap. Smak av spannm√•l och lite j√§rn. Rostad malt, choklad och kn√§ckiga toner. P√•taglig humlebeska med bitter avslutning
355ml bottle. Pours brown with a thick slightly tanned head. Roasted malts, chocolate. Quite intense and hard to describe. Really nice bitterness. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel.

Reddish brown, mahogany colur with a small, creamy tan head. Aroma has malts, some spices, coriander, grass. Malty taste, pretty rich flavour, bitter finish. Medium body, low carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Very nice overall, great for the winter season.

Clear deep red/brown with small white head. Sweet malty aroma (caramel, bread, dough and overripe fruits), some hay/grassy hop aroma and some vinous alcohol presence as well. The taste is over ripe fruity sweet, vinous and has quite a lot of roasted malt flavor (toast, coffee) plus a quite hoppy bitter and acidic finish. On the hoppy side for an old ale I would say.

Pours a dark ruby red brown with tan head. A roasted and sweet malt and vanilla aroma. A strong alcohol taste with roasted malts, dark fruits, caramel, and hints of vanilla and chocolate. A dark fruit and dry malt aftertaste.

Pours dark brown with some red tones, light brown thick foam. Aroma is sweet toffee, butter, sweet fruits. Enjoyable well balanced smooth mouthfeel, malty breadiness dominates initially with light tones of chocolate and a slightly bitter end dominated by roasty tones. Certain fruitiness also appears that reminds of dried fruit. Alcohol very well hidden though it contributes with pleasant warmth. Excellent seasonal beer to be sipped in the cold months!
Bottle 33 cl. Dark brown, hazy with a lightbrown head. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and vanilla aroma. Medium sweet, light bitter, with a warm roasted and coffee end.
(Tap) clear, very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of roast, hint of chocolate liqueur; rich, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours dark brown with a thick tanned head. Smell of toffee, bready malts, some hops, nuts and hints of toast. Medium sweet, roasted malts at first, then some toast and ash, toffee, dark malts and caramel. Moderate to medium bitter finish. A superb brew!

My favorite Great Divide offering and my favorite winter seasonal. Rich malty flavors with hops shining through. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hyvin tumma, punertavanruskea olut, joka vaahtoaa todella runsaasti. Vaaleanbeige tiivis ja pitk√§√§n s√§ilyv√§ vaahto j√§tt√§√§ my√∂s kivasti pitsi√§ lasin reunoille. Houkuttelevassa tuoksussa humaloinnin mukanaan tuomaa eksoottista hedelm√§√§ ja havuisuutta, johon yhtyy paahteisuutta, kahvia ja suklaata kivalla, varsin toimivalla kombinaatiolla. Maku kahvinen ja karamellinen, mutta lyhyehk√∂n alun j√§lkeen alan valtaa havuinen ja greippinen katkeruus ja jopa viskim√§inen vivahdus, joka jyr√§√§ pitk√§ll√§ j√§lkimaullaan muut alleen. Melko t√§ytel√§inen suutuntuma ja suupielet makeassa tahmassa samalla, kun suussa maistuu edelleen jykev√§n greippinen ja havuinen katkero. Aika j√§nn√§ ja erikoinen kombinaatio. V√§h√§n jopa turhan erikoinen.
Pours a dark reddish brown color. Aromas of wood, dark fruit, and some sweetness. Flavors of whiskey?, caramel, and some faint hops.
Brown/burgundy color. Aroma is nuts, caramel and fruit. Taste of caramel, butterscotch, fruit cake and some spice and yeast. Sweet taste with light bitter finish. Wonderful Old Ale.

Can sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond shop. Clear amber with a small head. Aroma of chocolate, toasted nuts and cookies. Sweet, caramel, malt, honey, cookies, toasted bread, roasted, bitter finish. Medium-full bodied, low carbonation. Nice sipper.

Can sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond, Tel Aviv. Brownish-amber with brownish head. Aroma of chocolate, toffee, caramel, herbs and nuts. Flavor of nuts, chocolate, light hoppy bitterness, caramel, sweetish, a bit alcoholic. Oily texture, medium to full-bodied. Very nice.

(33 cl bottle in wine glass.) One of my first favorite craft beers which since then has declined a bit on the list since my taste buds has improved (or gotten worse..?). It has a full sweet chocolate character on both nose and mouth. Which is why I liked it in the first place. A bit too sweet and watery though for my evolved liking, hehe. But definitely a great brew.

Das wohl grandioseste Bier des letzten Monats mit all den komplexen Noten, die so wunderbar ausgewogen zusammengef√ºgt wurden. W√§rmend und dennoch frisch knackig. Dazu leicht im Malz, Fr√ºchten, einer entsprechenden Hopfigkeit und etwas Nuss. Toll.

Bottle from trade with HenrikO, many thanks. The beer has got a dark brown colour with a small, steady head and medium to smooth body. Aroma of hops and bread. Taste of roasted hops, barley, malt, woods, mild fruits, flowers and herbs. Hoppy-malty finish. Great beer.

Aroma of chocolate, raisins and some earthy esters. Nice deep reddish brown color with a fluffy tan head. Sweet malty chocolate up front. Notes of dark fruit float in between. Bitterness comes in sharply balancing sweetness nicely. Spicy bitterness with notes of pepper, smoke, and spicy fruit. Finish is slightly dry with a reprise of bitterness and some alcohol burn. Definitely warms you up.

0,355l bottle at home from trade with Nische, big thanks. BB 15.12.2016. dark brown color, small tan head. smells malty sweet, spices, wood, some dried fruits, raisins, nutty, marzipan, decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, raisins, spices, lightly roasted, peppery, some alcohol. finishes lightly roasted a bit dry with notes of spices, dried fruits and some spices. decent stuff, rather heavy / a bit alcoholic, rather Doppelbock-like. overall decent beer.
Pours a birch beer reddish brown with a creamy off white head which lingers.....aroma of sweet malt, touch of chocolate.......taste is grass, bitterness, coffee, wet tea leaves.
Dark brown appearance with little head. Complex tastes of oak, brown sugar and burnt caramel. Medium body, ok carbonation, and a burnt and sweet aftertaste. Sweet and good, but a bit too dry

On tap at Smelteverket, Oslo. Very dark, with mahogany looking colour, beige head. Malty, chocolaty and roasty with hints of vanilla and wood. Moderate to medium sweet with a certain bitterness. Tasty and balanced.

From a can, it¬ís a clear reddish brown, big froth tan head, nice lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, barley and oats? Flavor is moderately sweet, hints of toffee and fruit. Smooth, creamy and drinkable with a mildly bitter finish. This gets added to the shopping list.

M√∏rk brun, nesten sort med to fingre h√∏yt lys brunt skum. Lukter papp, trevirke, kakaopulver, kaffe og noe melkesjokolade. Smaker toast, sjokolade og kakao ogs√• her, samt skarp alkohol. Middels lang alkohol i avslutning.
6 fen 2016, tap. Brown and hazy. Nose is milk chocolate, alcohol, and a tad meaty. Ned/thin body and moderately fizzy. Milk chocolate and alcohol. Not too strong. Nice
12 oz. bottle. Pours light brown/reddish, small dissipating tan head. Aroma was malty and raisin. Taste was bitterness, malty. Slight alcohol burn.
Tap @ Angels Trumpet Ale House: Clear reddish-brown with an off-white head. Pleasant aroma of malts and mild spices. Anise noticed in flavor along with malts.
Pours a dark copper-brown from a bottle. Rich, caramel aroma to match the color, along with a big boozy taste. Good beer.

Klart r√∏dbrunt med lavt, hvitt skum. Herlig duft med kaffe, mokkab√∏nner, m√∏rk karamell og noen ubestemmelige frukttoner. Markant bitterhet i smaken som best√•r av grapefrukt, bitter sjokolade og kaffe. Denne satt!

Poured from 12 oz bottle into tulip glass.

Appearance: 2"+ tan head falls slowly with plenty of lacing. Color is dark reddish-brown. Plenty of streaming carbonation.
Aroma: rich roasted barley and a definite citrus rind hop background.
Mouthfeel: medium bodied and slightly astringent, dry finish.
Flavor: dark fruit flavors, raisins, caramel, and molasses along with citrus rind.
Overall: very well done.

Pours a clear(!) deep brown to copper body, with a beige head that ends up as a partially covering film, good lacing. Malty, sweet and strong aroma of milk chocolate, chocolate sauce, lightly roasted malt, hints of hops and a light fruitiness, all upon a sugary background. Strong flavour of massive chocolate that lasts all the way into the aftertaste, dark caramel, roasted malt, generic fruits and citrus. A complex background of dark dried fruits, pine needles (especially in the long-lasting moderate to heavy bitter chocolate finish) and hints of rosemary. Moderate sweet initial taste. Medium body, smooth texture, very soft carbonation consisting of tiny bubbles. Brilliant!
[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 1 year before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Bottle. Pours dark maroon, with an airy off white head. Aroma is roasted malts with bread, nuts and toffee, as well as caramel and kandi. Full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is roasted malts with bread, caramel and kandi, as well as nuts, leather, dark fruits, wood and fruity hops with citrusy notes. Lingering malty finish with dark fruity notes.
Dark mahogany color with a fluffy light tan head. Mellow malty aroma. Rich malty flavor with an earthy and slightly roasty character. Medium smooth body.

Can - good size tan foamy head, dark brown color, big complex malty aroma and flavor, good earthy hop balance, mild alcohol notes, fairly smooth finish, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours deep copper with a tan head. Nose is tame and leans toward caramel. Flavor is richer with a lightly roasted blend of brown sugar, chocolate, and light hop tones. finish is quick and sticky.

Mycket m√∂rkt rubinr√∂d, medelstort skum. Malts√∂t lite kryddig doft med inslag av apelsin och kryddor. Smaken √§r lite k√§rvt tr√§ig med kn√§cks√∂tma, br√§nt socker, apelsinskal, ingef√§ra samt en l√•ng fin efterbeska. En suver√§n Old Ale med julig karakt√§r.

On tap at the Foundry. I¬íve enjoyed this previously and was sorry to see it leave as a seasonal, but with the current proliferation of porters, stouts and darker strong seasonal ales, this one seems now to get lost in a tsunami of newer and better brews. It¬ís still fine, quite malt heavy and hop bitter as well. Not well rounded, however, and despite the ABV, it tastes like an over the top porter. Possibly I just don¬ít understand what an old ale is, or possibly that¬ís just some vague delineation describing brews that don¬ít really fit conveniently into any more well known category. Time for more research.

Tasting session, thanks to Tibor Rebak from Brewdog. Dark brown body with a mahogany tinge. Slim to none off white head. Heavy malt and nut flavored taste up front. Mild sweetness in the background. Clean finish.

330ml bottle. Rather hazy redish brown with beige head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, dried fruits, grapefruit, apricot marmelade and chocolate. Taste of toffee, caramel, chocolate, bitter orange marmelada and grapefruit. Medium mouthfeel, light-medium carbonation and bitter-sweet aftertaste.
SB best√§llning, flaska. Frisk humle med br√∂d och k√∂tt kanske skinka men r√∂kt. Mer br√§nd rostad √§n r√∂kt. Stadig kropp med j√§mnhet . Inget h√•l i mitten.

Dark amber color with a fairly big tan head. Aroma is biscuity. Taste is sweet caramel, bready, raisins, a bit of hops bitterness and some booze. Aftertastes is remnants of the caramel sweetness and a tiny bit of hops bitterness. Pretty darn good, even though I¬ím not a big fan of the style.

Bottle
Amber, clear white head
Aroma of candy, orange, 
Taste sweet, alcoholic, orange and hint of bitter.

Bottle. Caramel, malty and earthy aroma, clear, dark reddish brown colour, long-life small beige creamy head, medium body, soft carbonation, sweet caramel taste, bitter metallic and alcoholic taste. Nice one.
R√∂dbrun med smutsvit skum. Doftar och smakar mycket karamellmalt, lite r√∂kigt. Fyllig med lagom beska helt ok
Deep orange brown pour, foamy off white head. Aroma of caramel, roast, sweet. Flavor of caramel, butterscotch, roast, fruit.

Bottle. Pours a dark brownish ruby red with a mostly fading light beige soft head. Aroma of caramel, golden syrup, malty, copper, earthy. Taste is of caramel, red fruits, earthy, spice, dark fruits, hint of liquorice, bitter metallic flavours on the finish. Heavy foamy to oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Flaska fr√•n SB, troligtvis ett √•r gammal. Jul√∂lsprovning med Nerikes √ñls√§llskap. Djupt rubinr√∂d i f√§rgen med bieget gr√§ddigt skum. Maltig doft, m√∂rkrost med tillh√∂rande syra, torkad frukt och choklad. Tung kropp med bra beska redan fr√•n b√∂rjan, uppbackad av en grymt malttung grund. N√•got kryddig. Funkar bra med en bit m√∂rk choklad till. Ganska torr och l√§tt r√∂kig. Blir intressant att se hur den blir efter ytterlige ett √•r eller tv√•.

¬íTis the season for robust, dark brews. Great Divide Hibernation is exactly the kind of elixir you need to get in the spirit. Hibernation pours garnet with a finger of light tan head - gorgeous. Aroma of toasted malt with a hint of alcohol sugar. Caramel, chocolate, syrup, and buttery toffee on the tongue. Body is exceptionally smooth and rich. Hibernation certainly speak to the English style of Old Ale. The alcohol is very well hidden under the malty sweetness. You don¬ít really taste/smell/feel much of the booze. It¬íll sneak up on you, though. Not to milk the Hibernation theme too much, but one bottle of this was enough before my ass was ready for bed.

355 mL bottle. Coppery in colour, with a film of head. Very meaty/malty in the nose. It manages to smell big without a whiff of booze. There is a little booze in the flavour, which adds some complexity. This one is, I don¬ít know, a cross between a doppelbock and an alt. Interesting.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Poured from bottle. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and gas. Good lookin deep mahogany with lacing tan head. Getting the caramel malt flavor along with hops, vanilla, banana and spice. Just a hint of alcohol. Well done.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
Nice malty sweetness in the aroma with burnt overtones, clear hints of cacao.. Almost black and head dies down rather quick, but there is a light brown thin top left.
Taste is complex, a lively first feel, some sweetness, a bit of caramel, nice bitterness and a long lingering finish with a warm and cocky feeling, well needed on a dark November evening.
Great beer..
Flaska fr√•n SB. M√∂rkt r√∂dbrun med beige skum. S√∂t doft av karamell och torkad frukt. Smak av karamell och kola med litw beska.

Bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours dark reddish brown with a small thin tan head. Nose is must, toasted and malty. Taste is leather with a porter feel to it. This is certainly not my favorite example of the style. Not bad but there are many better beers out there.

From site: English-style Old Ale. Hibernation Ale is Colorado‚Äôs original strong ale -- it has been Great Divide‚Äôs winter seasonal each year since 1995. Hibernation‚Äôs massive flavors are so intense that it requires over three months of aging each year. This lengthy aging process gives Hibernation its revered malty richness, complex hop profile and hearty warming character, which is perfect right out of the bottle or cellared for longer periods of time. 8.1% ABV through 2008 8.7% ABV in 2009

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear amber with small off white head. Aroma of toffee, chocolate, biscuit, coffee. Full bodied, smooth and well balanced. Low bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark copper. Aroma is malty, I get slight barnyard. Taste is Nice and complex. Coffee, toffee, slight alcohol. A Nice seasonal beer.
Bottle @ home. Delicious! Fantastic! This beer is worthy waiting for every year. One of my favourite seasonals.

This beer is delicious. One of the best old-style ale¬ís I¬íve had. It pours dark brown with a little splotchy head. The aroma is sweet spices, nutmeg, pears, pecans, other winter notes. The flavor is wonderful. Big caramel and tea qualities, with some citrus on the finish, and a boozy blast of vapor in the nose. Godamn good beer.

Reddish, dark amber hue. A subtle aroma of coffee & raisins. Rich, earthy taste with dry fruit sweetness balanced with a little sourness & some hop bitterness in the finish. 

Rated by BrewTom

Keg. Dark chestnut brown with a large beige head with good retention. Nose has cocoa, chocolate, dark malts, dark bread, light dark dried fruits and brown sugar. Flavour is bready with brown sugar, grain, dark dried fruit, vanilla, light cocoa, wood, light dried green plants. Medium body, sweet and filling, average carbonation, mild bitterness. Good balance. Long malty finish. Nice. Soft, mild easy drinking.

Pours red amber with big creamy head. Aroma is cocoa, coffee, toasted malts, dark chocolate, resin hops, liquorice, nuts and rasberry. Flavor is medium to heavy malts, medium bitter, pleasant finish but rather short. Body is medium, palate is oily, carbonation is average. Very pleasant, clear distinctive taste. One of the best beers I¬íve ever had.

Thought this was a winter seasonal but recently found a single, dark amber pour, nice big tna head. Aroma is earthy, very old-school, earth, herbs, grass, dark fruits. Flavor is medium boozy, toasted malt, earthy tones, light hint of cocoa and roast, this is killer.
Donker bier met veel alfohol. Warme smaak met veel hop. Apart bier maar erg fijn !
Easy drinking with lots of thick malt. Pours dark brown with good head and lacing. Caramel and hint of smoke. Light sweet finish. Bottle.
Bottle shared thanks to richthevillan. Dark copper beer with small head. Aroma of caramel and brown bread. Taste is sweet malts, ; caramel and a touch of spice with a little treacle. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Brewdog Birmingham; dark copper pour with a thin tan head, aroma has some dark malts, smoke, some nutty action, toffee apple.
Rich nut and mild chocolate aroma. Dark brown body with a mahogany tinge. Slim to none off white head. Heavy malt and nut flavored taste up front. Mild sweetness in the background. Clean finish.

2012 bottle (I cant believe I never rated this before... had numerous times): Deep mahogany hue with a fizzy but mostly lasting head, spotty lace. Earthy rich bready malts, toffee and caramel apples, a hint of tobacco and wood with a splash of rocky minerals. Still some minty and herbaceous hop bittering left that should fade with more time. The mouth feel is not has heavy nor comporting as the best of the genre, seems too carbonated for an Olde Ale. Still this is a baby and should progress with 2 or 3 more years in the cellar.

Tap at New Bohemia in Northeast Mpls. Bumped pint glass. Deep amber in color with really limited head. (Not a great pour) Aroma has hops and a nuttiness that is appealing. Little bit of tropical fruit. Taste leans towards the sweet side of the equation with a syrupy, dark fruit element. Slight bitterness at the end. Soft mouthfeel. Very solid effort. Taste has an enjoyable sweetness that really feels like it complements a cold, crisp night. Hibernation seems like the perfect name. I would cuddle up in my pajamas and drink this all night.

On tap at New Bohemia. Dark red color with minimal white head. Sweet hoppy bitter mix aroma. Heavy body. Sweet hoppy upfront with a slight bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at new bohemia in pint glass. Light mahogany color with small white head. Roasted malt and darker aroma. Sweet and sugary malt resin. Not exactly what I expected. Kinda sweet and pruny. Didn¬ít love it.
on tap. Brown in color with a small light brown head. Subtle boozy aroma. Medium bodied with smooth texture. A touch bitter and somewhat sweet with mostly malty flavor notes. Pretty good.

Aroma and taste comprises sweet malts, dark dried fruits, some apricot, treacle, pretty complex brew, like this.

---Sent via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank this last Christmas but have saved a few bottles, so why not crack a 355ml bottle tonight. Dark brown-black, slightly tan, creamy head. Sweet and hoppy aroma, it smells of dark syrup, apricot, leather and pine needles. Rustic flavor, roasted malt, sweet fruits, apricot, mango. Bitterness of chocolate and coffee. At the end, bitter from pine needles. Several great flavors, great enjoyment in this.
Smooth and very chocolatey with a bit of coffee. Rich, matly and flavorful.
caramel aroma, toast aroma, appear red/brown with a fine white head. taste light sweet, light bitter. average carbonation light sweet aftertaste.

Tap. Pours slight cloudy dark ruby bet with small creamy head. Aroma is toasty and fruity. Dark berries, milk chocolate, caramel, toffee, booze. Some apples. Taste sweet, toasty malts, caramel, berries, milk chocolate and slight sour. Dry toasty finish. Low carbonation and some alcohol.

Deep amber color with a light brown head. Aroma is hoppy with caramel notes, also grass and some wood notes. Flavor is crispy and dry, sweet and bitter from hops and some fruit. Strong bitter lasting end. Average body and carbonation.

Bottled 08/28/14. Pours chestnut molasses color, no head. Aroma is caramel, molasses, toffee, almost bourbon-barrel quality, vanilla. All malt. Flavor is caramel, toffee, vanilla, slight bourbon quality again comes through, very slight almost coffee bitterness quality. Pretty good.
Pours brown with a tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Silky smooth on the tongue with a sweet malt finish.
355ml Flasche. Dunkelbraun und naturtr√ºb. Minimale Schaumkrone. Aroma von Karamell und Kaffee. Malzig. Stark s√ºsslicher Nachgeschmack.
Old rating. Bronze colored. Big malts, sweet chocolate, some coffee, some dried fruit, nutty, tobacco. ABV hid fairly well, though big mouthfeel. Pretty tasty.

Caoba oscuro, espuma beis. Aromas de chocolate, caramelo, toffee, vainilla y tostados. Inicio dulce de caramelo y cacao que pasa a un amargor tostado de intensidad media-alta que equilibra el trago muy bien.
16.1.2015. Dark red-brown beer. Aroma of coffee, molasses, slight raisin and slight oak, plums. Tastes molasses, wood, raisin, oak, slight ethanol.

Bottled on Jan 05, 2015.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance has a ruddy brown color with a one finger white foamy head.
It dissipated nicely leaving some nice stringy sticky lacing.
The smell had a decent chocolate maltiness and a light coffee aroma.
The taste was sweet and roasty through the malts. A light rolling roasty chocolate/coffee aftertaste leads into a sticky sweet/roasty finish.
On the palate, this sat about a medium on the body. I¬íd say a good sipper but the alcohol isn¬ít felt.
Overall, I¬íd say this was a good old ale for the style and for me.

Aroma. Hops, and barley, nothing crazy, but nice.
Appearance: Dark but bright, Bronze color. Medium white head. 
Taste: smooth ale. Some grasses and vegetable, but mostly malt flavored. Well balanced. Was perfect call with my cheeseburger.
Feel: medium carbonation, smooth.

Nice beer.
Good old ale, covers all bases. Toffee, cocoa, oxidized quality and some caramel. Tad bit of bitterness on the finish

Aroma: alcohol, smoke, soy sauce
Appearance: orange-red color, clear, minimal head, 
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall: great beer, would recommend

Archers, Dayton, OH, draft. Strong. Tastes malty, like a brown ale. Creamy head. Good lacing. Pretty smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle at home. Dark copper - brown color with red notes and yellowish beige head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee in the beginning, caramel, spicy - some cinnamon notes, light chocolate, fruity - sweet berries, hoppy. Sweet and bitter taste like the aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Bottle at home. Dark and strong. Very malty with a touch of sweetness but mostly bitter, I¬íd say. Earthy hop character also. Complex. lovely stuff :)

Bottle at home. Pours a dark Amber brown with a quick dissipating tan head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, a bit of cherry, faint spice and chocolate. Smells fantastic. Taste is dark caramel, toffee, toast, a bit of fruitiness (light raisins and cherries), and finishes with a bit of chocolate. Lots going on, lots to enjoy. Medium heavy body, high carbonation and a bit of a dry finish. This is good.

Bottle. Pours very deep ruby brown with thin off-white head. Nose has vinous and even cidery notes - hints of tannin-like woodiness, oaky caramel, vanilla, smells cellared in that it has an earthy - but not funky - depth. A hint of berry-like hops. Nose is subdued but rich. Palate has low carbonation, which is true to style, and has substantial hop resin and mild alcohol hotness that subside as it warms. Flavor is nutty, with some smoky roastedness at the beginning finishing with pronounced alcohol presence and some bitterness - gets more round and rich as it warms (and become very very good actually - best drinking temp seems to be around 50F).

Bottle. After tasting the Barrel aged version, I decided to give this a whirl. Nice notes of molasses, Earth, bread, coffee and raisin. Not as good as 
the barrel aged, but still very impressive.

12oz bottle, bottled 10/2/14. Appearance: Dark brown and opaque with hint of ruby. No head. 
Aroma: Roasted coffee along with leather, toffee, and caramel. 
Taste: Deep rich malt sweetness with flavors of caramel and molasses, raisins, chocolate, leather, and a hint of peppery spice. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body with little carbonation. Not quite the viscosity and alcohol warmth. 
Finish: a slight roastiness and dry peppery spice lingers on the tongue. 
Overall: A really complex ale perfect for those cold winter nights.

From a 12 oz bottle with a bottle date Sep 17, 2014. Consumed 01/03/2015. This pours a murky brown, a little bit of light coming through at the edges, with a 1-2 finger light light tan head. Looks like muddy pond water. Aroma is caramelized sugar, toffee, butterscotch, bready. Taste is where is thing just took me back, yes there¬ís the toffee, but there¬ís bittersweet coffee, slight roasty chocolate, and this thing other thing, reminds me of walking into a cigar shop, just wet tobacco. It doesn¬ít sound pleasant, but it¬ís killer in this beer. It¬ís a medium beer, heavier side of medium. Old ales aren¬ít a great style for me, tend to be pretty one note, but this was exceptional in the style. Love that tobacco.
Tap at BrewDog Nottingham. Pour is dark with hardly a head, aroma is caramel, coffee. Taste is malty, alcohol, sweet, coffee notes towards the finish. Tasty and interesting

Keg at BD Shepherd¬ís Bush tap takeover, London. It pours a dark copper, almost brown color, with a medium beige head. Aroma is sweet and lightly spicy, with notes of caramel, egg, lactose, nutmeg and dried fruits. Taste is again sweet, lightly roasty and malty, lightly spicy. More notes of lactose, dark chocolate, dried fruit, nuts and nutmeg. Finish lightly bitter and warming, with some alcohol kick. Medium to full bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, nice old ale
Keg at brewdog bar, Leeds. Brown ale with white head. Smells farmy and of pigs! Aromas of nice toffee and tea. Taste is bitter and a little sour. Medium carb and body. Ok stuff.
Fruity. Long aftertaste. A bit sour in a nice way. Not a lot of carbon. A nice evening at Mallaskukkko, Turku, Finland
Py√∂r√§kadulla 2/2015. Wonderful ale, full bodied, richly hoppied, well balanced.

12 oz bottle poured. Pours a dark brown color with a bubbly head. Smooth rich malt flavor with a nutty finish. A lot of flavor in this one, and it lingers forever. Subtle hops throughout, as well as some brown sugar, maple, and a little chocolate. Aroma is a ton of sweet malt. I nice warming beer here. Enjoyed this.

Keg at BD Sheps Bush. It pours deep red-brown with a medium beige head. The nose is rich, toasty caramel, fruit cake, raisin, wood, toffee and leather. The taste is smooth, toasty, bitter-sweet, caramel, light alcohol, leather, varnish, earth, mild spice and cocoa with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Smooth, well rounded and quaffable. Very good.

1/2 pint @ brewdog bar. Body is dark red brown, head is medium creamy beige average lasting excellent lacing. Nose is roasty, aroma is roasted peanuts, coffee, licorice, soy sauce. Light sweet, heavy roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty bitter, light alcohol warmth. Full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Not too easy, excellent dessert beer.

Tap at BrewDog Liverpool. Hazy dark reddish brown. Tan head. Lots of coffee and dark, toasty, earthy malts in the aroma. Taste is much the same: toasty and caramelised. Hint of red grape in the background. Decent stuff but not quite in line with how I expect a beer of this style to be.

holy smokes, this stuff is strong - with (at least) three months of aging, you get plenty of coffee, dark malt, caramel hazelnuts, cocoa, molasses, licorice, and vanilla flavours. I find this a bit out of balance - very powerful aromas, lacks elegance.
Growler. Pours clear dark brown with no head. Aromas of nutty flavours, caramel, malts, chocolate. Taste is alike with some honey-like sweet notes.

355ml bottle from ,I think, cornelius. Pours clear nut-brown, long-lasting off-white head. Aromas of coffee, cocoa, hazelnuts. Taste is nutty more cocoa, light almond booze hit. Warming finish. Not bad.
Nice big malty hoppy swamp with bready,funky, almost Belgian overtones. Great rich lacing. A beast but real smooth like. Top drawer from GD as ever here.

12oz bottle poured into a snifter.

Hibernation pours a deep reddish plumb with a thick creamy beige head that lasts a long while. The aroma is earthy wood, molasses, floral and caramel. The flavor is molasses, caramel and earthy wood initially with a bit of floral hop and bread tucked away in the background.
Great ale! Carmel, malt, hops, and dash of cherry in the nose. Body encapsulates all except the cherry. Smooth, balanced, and mildly carbonated. Would buy again

Not sure how I was missing this one... Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 8.7%. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted, chocolate, dark fruits and wood. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, chocolate, dark fruits, oak, medium sweet, hop, little plume, little dry, little vanilla, hop and medium bitter.

330ml bottle, dark brown pour with a small head.. Chocolate malt and burnt caramel. Lacking a bit of complexity in the middle with lingering burnt caramel with balance from earthy hop. Finish is light bitter. Body is full, texture, with soft carbonation. Drinks nice and easy for the strength.

Keg at Brewdog Brum. Brown. Sips a smokey choc, but then broadens out into a sticky bark malt breather. Nice sweetness and controlled booze on finish. Deceptively complex. Good stuff. Nice to try a really proficient malt-led beer.

Tap. Czarne jak w?giel. Piana obfita, g?sta, drobna, bardzo mocno znaczy szk?o. Armaty kawowe zakrywaj? wszystko. smak s?odki o niskiej goryczce, bardzo du?o nut palonych - czekolada, kawa, tosty. Bardzo dobre, ?wietnie u?o?ony alkohol

Bottle, 13C. Deep brown with a fat coat of beige head. Rich nutty aroma with chocolate, toasty caramel, some dried fruit, oranges and herbs. Intriguing, fairly boozy. On the full side of medium bodied, lowish carbonation. Sweet and malty with more caramel than chocolate or nuts. Lacks a bit of bottom end rumble. Fairly firm bitterness slides through. Some bitter oranges, licorice and spices at the end. Smells great, lacks a bit of presence and character in the middle.
Chestnut brown color, beige head. Toffee nose, brown sugar, fruit, dates, raisins, coffee. Sweet taste, caramel malt, alcohol, yeast, hint of chocolate, bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Keg at brewdog Edinburgh. Pours deep ruby brown, nose is chocolate, coffee, spices, taste is rich caramel, fruity, sweet, dry roasted.

Keg at Brewdog Shep¬ís Bush. Aroma is charred maple coated meat, brown sugar, roast. Opaque bit clear reddy brown coloured pour with a lasting cream coloured head. Flavour is charred meat, very sweet, unrefined sugars, maple sryup. Palate is sweet, velvety and moderate carbonation. Lingering brown malts and smoked meat.

Bottle at rickfifty¬ís. Dark brown to dark red colour. Some white to slightly yellow head. Malt heavy nose and flavour. Also some alcohol, raisin, plum and red fruit nose. Malt, raisin, rose, chocolate, hint of coffee, red fruit, a tiny bit of ripe and sweet cherry flavour. Medium carbonation. Medium to full body. Quite slick and oily. Mostly bitter. A little bit of sweet and sour as well.

Dark reddish/brown colour with a small head. Aroma of malt, caramel and some chocolate and orange and a slight smell of brown sugar. Taste of chocolate, cacao and a coffee bitterness. Smooth background with brown sugar. Dry.
Pours amber with aroma of hops. Sweet and malty flavor followed by a bitter hoppy finish. Nothing all that remarkable.
Dark amber color, roasted malt and creamy with some hops. Quite sweet with a full body. Average but lingering bitterness.

Pours a dark, hazy caramel with moderate head that dissipates over time. Light aroma that intensified as this beer warmed a bit - roasty malt and slightly sweet. Full bodied with light carbonation. Roasted malt flavor with a bit of sweetness. Not my favorite style or beer, but glad I tried it. Good sipping beer and would probably not drink more than one in a night.

Bottle at home from McHugh¬ís, Dublinhazy dark chestnut brown with beige lacing. Fruity red apple and biscuit. Lively carbonation, full bodied, dry, toasty, vegetal, warming. No wow factor like other GD beers

How: Bottle Apperance: Brown/hazel, medium off-white head. Aroma: Rye bread, caramel, spice, high end chocolate, some nutty aroma in the background. Taste: Well balananced, semi-sweet, nice bitterness. Palate: medium to full bodied, almost creamy texture, medium carbonation. Nice bitter finish.

Not a malty fan but can still chive this beer credit that it has great flavor. Just a bit heavier than I normally like. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I can¬ít speak to the style, but this is one delicious beer. First had on tap then bought a six-pack. Tastes like a stout with pronounced coffee, but with a lot of complexity and layers of flavor, including date and chocolate. Full bodied with great mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Bottle from SB 141231. 
Dark amber with no head. Fullbodied nose and taste with dried fruits plums and raisins. Malty bitterness with an adstringent feel. Good sipping beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of sweet malt, spice, booze, oak and not much else. Not a great scent; I was expecting better. Looks much better than it smells, pouring out a dark ruby/brown color with a small off white cap of foam. Tastes like a malt bomb at first, then some hop sharpness comes creeping in. Very well balanced and drinkable. Again, like the aroma I was expecting more and I¬ím a little underwhelmed. Palate is thin. I don¬ít get it with this one; I must be missing something.

Pours a reddish brown with khaki head. Head dissipates quickly. Aroma - biscuit, molasses, touch of hops. Taste - coffee, molasses, caramel. Carbonation is tingly and finish is quite long (bitter dark malt).
Dark semi transparent pecan color, thick toasty malt aroma. Plenty of chocolate and oak with a light bite finish. Warm wood and malt linger

Draught at Bishops Arms Gamla Stan, Stockholm.
Very dark copper body, with a big, stable, creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, nuts, wood, some ash, dark and dried fruits and subtle hops.
Taste with about the same aromas, but with much more fruity and piney hops and more nuts.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes roasty, dry, wooden.

Quaffable! Full, roasty, but also very hoppy and overall very smooth. Like a lighter, more drinkable and less complex Barley Wine. Enjoyed this a lot!

Tap at Arichie¬ís. Clear, medium red-brown with a thick tan head. Aroma is very malty, sweet, dark fruit, caramel, sugary. A bit of alcohol on the nose, but not bad. Flavor follows the aroma closely with the sugary maltiness, raisins and plums, but doesn¬ít have the alcohol as evident. Palate is good, very heavy and not harsh with the carbonation. Overall a nice winter beer.
Raisin, plumb, oak, Brown sugar nose. Dark, dark brown pour, nice dead and lacing. Taste is dark fruits, pine, sweet alcohol, very nice. Warms the heart and soul.
caramel, roasty, toast, resin, alcohol, golden, hazy, minimal head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation,

Poured a 12oz bottle into a nonic pint glass. Mostly clear mahogany colour, redder when held to the light, beige foam which quickly subsided, some lasting lace. Bready, nutty, toasty, some stout-like roasty traits, not very malty in terms of residual sweetness. Strong bitterness and earthy English-style hop flavour. Mildly tart and acidic, medium body and carbonation, lingering tannic grapeskin and woodsy aftertastes. Alcohol is definitely pronounced, and not exactly smooth. Not a truly representative English Old Ale in my opinion, but fairly tasty in its own rite.

It pours brown with a minimal head. It has molasses aromas with alcohol, and a minimal bit of hops. It has a rich texture of a bit of lively carbonation a combination of malt and alcohol and it warms the palate.

Damn fine olde ale. Robust and malty goodness. Well balanced with a complex hop profile and warm hearty character. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Deep red. Dark fruit, big malty aroma. The taste adds leather, brown sugar, a hint of chocolate, maybe some toffee/caramel elements. Smooth and rich texture. A Very good winter brew. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Old Ale is not a style many breweries are doing as they were traditionally made (i.e. actually aging beer for a significant period of time). Most breweries just brew a barleywine ad call it an old ale, but in the case of Great Divide Hibernation Ale, it appears to be a traditional brew (according to BJCP guidelines, that is). It¬ís a good beer to drink to appreciate that dedication to classic brewing techniques, and it¬ís also a good beer to drink because it¬ís a good beer.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass. It was bottled on 8/27/14 and cost $2.99 ($0.25 per ounce).

Appearance: Dark reddish/brown hue with sediment particles in suspension. Pours to a two-finger, off-white, foamy head which laces and retains well.

Smell: Sweet confectionary aromas, especially chocolate and toffee, but with a strong dark malt base. Some dark fruit notes as well. 

Taste: It¬ís no surprise that the malts are the stars of the show here. Rich sweetness right away in the form of dark fruit notes, similar to that of a barleywine. A general m√©lange of cherry, fig and raisin as well as distinct syrupy flavors of toffee and chocolate-covered burnt toast. What¬ís curious is there¬ís actually quite a strong hop presence in the form of flavor and bitterness. I get light citrus flavors, but a fairly strong dry bitterness. There¬ís also some tanginess most likely due to oxidation (though this is normal). The alcohol imparts a warming sensation and accentuates the confectionery flavors but creating a slight vanilla character. Overall, it¬ís a tasty brew and a great example of how this style can be done today.

Drinkability: With a soft mouthfeel and smooth texture, Great Divide Hibernation Ale is quite pleasing to drink. Plenty of body and raw weight at 8.7% ABV, though there¬ís no abrasive heat from the alcohol. A slight lingering dryness on the tongue. It works well as a sipper.

Klar, ganska m√∂rk r√∂d-orange med ett snyggt, guld-orange skum. Doft: Malt, alkohol, lite dessert vin, burk persika, inlagda p√§ron, vanilj, fruktsoda. Smak: Malt, lite tr√§ och barr, p√§ron och melon glass, , humle, lite burk persika. √Ñr ganska s√• f√§rsk och det k√§nns som den vill ha mer tid.
Very enjoyable malty beer. Aroma: complex; leather, dried fruit. Full body, pleasant bitter aftertaste.

355ml bottle. Dark brown body with a medium white head, leaving loads of lacing on it¬ís way down. Aromas of roasted malt, wood, nuts, dark chocolate and spices. Malty taste, with notes of dark chocolate, roasted malt and honey.
Draft at Root Down (Denver airport, C concourse). Reddish brown, minimal foam. Nice winter seasonal, malty coffee, toffee, in a traditional strong ale.
Pours dark brown with a great beige head. Hints of toffee and coffee in the aroma and a very malty taste. I guess this beer is what it should be, but I¬ím not a fan of the style.
I wonder how true to style this is an an old ale. It¬ís a nice winter warmer. Has the flavor profile of a toned down/light barleywine.

pours dark amber. Very interesting soil/peat moss nose. Toasted malt aroma comes through as it warms in the glass. Taste is dominated by toffee and licorice. With this the winter will be easy to get through.

12 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at approximately 40 degrees F.

A: Pours a deep ruby brown, forming a relatively thin pale white head that recedes quickly to a ring. Holding the beer to daylight reveals an exceptionally clear red-brown brew with decent streams of carbonation from the bottom. Lacing is persistent, if a tad patchy.

S: Toasted, warm caramel-toffee malts, with the smells of warm peat moss and damp potting soil mixed in as well. There¬ís a tinge of smoke, and some shadows of dark fruit.

T: At the start, this was smoky, earthen, and definitely peaty, a bitter brew to drink. There was sweetness present, but entirely subsumed by the soil, bark, and ashes, with something of a black licorice tinge to the finish. As it warms, the bitterness fades to allow more of a balance with the sweeter, breadier malts - entirely my fault, I should have started this one out warmer. Caramel and toffee play off of the smoky earthiness, and allow some faint undertones of dried dark fruit to skitter about the distant reaches of the palate. There¬ís also more of a light coffee note to the finish.

M: Surprisingly light-bodied, with prickly carbonation levels.

O: With the first few sips, I was unimpressed with what seemed to be an unbalanced beer. That opinion changed upwards in correlation with the temperature. Would repeat, and at cellar temperatures.
Tap, brown pour, white head, nose is coffee, taste is coffee, boozy, pretty strong

Poured from a bottle. Pours deep dark mahogany, muddy brown. Aroma is smoky, peaty malts, coffee and chocolate. Taste is a mix of roasted malt and smoked malt, and some chocolate. Overall a top notch beer.
bottle - Pours a deep copper with creamy head. Strong sweet malt aroma. Taste is complex with an alcohol bite before the finish. Probably better if aged, not for me at this point.

thick brown color with about a finger of tan head that leaves lacing. aroma is toasted malts and cocoa. Flavor is dark chocolate, toasted malts, molasses, and toffee. thick mouth feel with soft carbonation.

Dark mahogny, clear beer with a two finger beige head. 
Nose: Dried fruit, plum, roasted sweet malt, raisin, coffee, brown sugar and herbs.
Taste: Sweet caramel malt, chocolate, pumpernickel and some licorice. 
Body: Full complex body with a big a malty backbone. Medium carbonatet. Feels a little tickeling and spicy. Light bitterness at the end.
This is a great Old Ale that fits perfectly at christmas (and you should celebrate christmas all year round!)

Bottled on: SEP 18 2014

Appearance: Very dark brown opaque body with a creamy off-white head that leaves great lacing on the glass.

Aroma: There is this amazing coffee aroma that leaps from the glass. It smells fantastic. A slight note of charcoal on the nose as well.

Taste: It starts out with a rich coffee and a bit of wood flavor, touched by a slight burnt note and bitterness at the back. It finishes very clean, leaving just a bit of coffee on the tongue. I can taste the alcohol in this, but at 8.7% ABV (from the bottle) I wouldn¬ít call that a deal-breaker.

Mouthfeel: It feels very thick and full bodied. Good carbonation for this beer. It has a nice coating presence on the palate.

Overall: It¬ís a great beer, plain and simple. It has a lot of rich flavors but they are removed from the palate once the sip is done which leaves you ready to have another sip immediately. I recommend grabbing it and giving it a shot if you¬íre a fan of higher alcohol stouts and porters. It doesn¬ít taste like a lot of other Old Ales that I¬íve had, but it¬ís good in its own right.
It has a really great Malt flavor to it. I¬ím not sure if it¬ís Chocolate Malt, or what, but it¬ís delicious.
Poured from a bottle, dark copper, tan head.  Strong malty taste with nice hop, lively effervescence, nice malty aroma, the attention out into the making if this beer is noted, great beer.

Almost like a big burly Scotch Ale. Pours a deep red amber with a tan head that disappears fairly quickly but leaves good lacing. Great richness to the mouthfeel without being cloying. Certainly a long finish with good alcohol warmth. Delicious!

Tasted at taproom. Nutty caramel and spice on the nose. Excellent soft slight chewy mouthfeel with a nice subtle bubbly carbonation. Taste has caramel sweetness to slight bitterness and finishing with cinnamon and nutmeg spice. Makes for a nice fall sipper.

Transfer from BA review on 11-13-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance ¬ñ The beer pours a brownish mahogany color with hints of ruby red seen shining through when held up to the light. Upon pouring there is a small tan colored head that fades relatively rapidly, leaving some foamy islands on the surface of the beer and a foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell ¬ñ The aroma is big and malty with lots of sweetness. The matiness is a very nice combination of toasted malt, chocolate, and a more brown bread like smell. Mixed with these aromas are the sweet, which are heaviest of a toffee and caramel smell with other sweeter smells of molasses and candied sugar. Rounding out the sweet and malty smells are some aromas of spice accompanied by a bit of vanilla and some earthy and herbal smells as well as a little bit of a woody smell. 

 Taste ¬ñ The taste starts out with a roasted malt flavor melding with some flavors of chocolate and caramel. The caramel flavors become more buttery as the taste moves on to the middle, taking on a more toffee like flavor. The chocolate flavor fades some from the tongue being replaced by flavors of coffee. With the coffee so too comes some molasses and brown sugar flavors as well as a bit of spice. Other flavors of an earthy hop and a bit of herb also come to the tongue, which when combined with the coffee, brings a bit of bitterness to the taste, unfortunately taking away from the wonderfully drinkable sweet and malty flavors a bit. With a little bit of warming booziness coming to the tongue at the very end, one is left with a slightly bitter, malty and still fairly sweet taste to linger on the tongue. 

 Mouthfeel ¬ñ The body of the beer is thick in the front of the taste with it becoming more average more toward the back-end with a carbonation level that on the average side. While rather nice overall, a thicker body through the taste would have been slightly nicer for the sweet and malt, potentially holding them up in flavor to the end of the taste. 

 Overall ¬ñ For the most part it was a very nice drinking Old Ale with an amazing aroma, and a good set of sweet and malty flavors. A little less bitterness may have suited the style and my preferences a bit more, but overall it was a very nice drinking beer.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 12 oz bottle poured into brandy snifter. It starts out with the sweet smell of vanilla and chocolate, with a touch of butterscotch, with perhaps a note of earthiness to it. As the head recedes, the aroma morphs into something more similar to ripe, tart dark red cherries with some woody notes (maybe some raisin in there too?). A deep, dark cranberry coloring to the beer stands out (although it¬ís probably more mahogany, but the fluorescent lighting is playing tricks on me) with a tan head that sits atop the beer as a moderate to thin film with some sparse lacing. A moderate sweet-tartness is most noticeable, in moderate amounts, with some light toasty, woody notes. After a little time, some hop bitterness pokes through along with a touch of sour cherry. An average amount of carbonation keeps the beer relatively medium to light bodied, although it definitely has a slightly syrupy quality to it. There¬ís a mild aftertaste consisting mainly of toasted malt with some dark chocolate and floral notes. By mid-glass, this taste changes into a smooth caramel with some light spice - the floral notes are still present. There¬ís a pleasant warming quality to this beer at the finish.

One year later, this same batch take on more roasted notes of coffee, raisin, and cacao with some port wine alcohol, a hint of ginerbread, and grapes late. The color of the beer is now an oily dark caramel brown color with noticeable sediment floating within. The head thins out a bit with just a thin soapy ring and a wispy surface. The body gains some weight to it as the slick and slightly sticky beer is more full bodied with toasted notes and flavors of cacao. There¬ís an earthiness as well as a touch of a metallic and burnt characters and a hint of gingerbread. It finishes with a port wine warmth and a clean resin licorice spiciness. The aftertaste is astringent and slightly metallic with note of spice, dark chocolate, dark cherries, and nuts.

Pours an amber brown with a very thin film of a head. Aroma is malty, sweet dark fruits and nuts. Tastes of roasted malts, chocolate covered raisins, and a slight bitterness with just a touch of warmth from alcohol. Pretty nice ale for the winter months. I like it.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 8/30/2013. Pours crystal clear deep ruby red color with a 2 finger dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big caramel, toffee, cocoa, chocolate, coffee, brown sugar, roasted malt, nuttiness, toast, brown bread, herbal, wood, pepper, light pine, and roasted earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and hop notes; with great strength. Taste of caramel, toffee, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, nuttiness, brown sugar, toast, brown bread, herbal, floral, wood, light pepper, light pine, and roasted earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toffee, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, wood, brown sugar, roasted malt, nuttiness, and herbal earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice balance and complexity of dark malt and moderate hop flavors; with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a moderately creamy and smooth mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent old ale! All around great balance and complexity of dark malt and moderate hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
Orange body. Sweet rice pudding with a bit of hops. A nice beer. On tap at republic mpls.
A really nice ale. Though I don¬ít know why it¬ís rated so high. Aromas of dark fruit and some spice. Similar sweet and malty flavors. Nice.

Smells like dry cocoa, multigrain cereal and a crisp hit of roasted coffee beans. This beer pours a dark dark mahogany but isn¬ít the least bit hazy. A beautiful beer for a style that usually isn¬ít. Drinks like roasted, toasted cereal dusted with a little malt powder and cocoa. The finish taste like bitter, dry roasty coffee along with a nice hop presence mixing in. Bottom line is this is my favorite winter/olde ale. I mean what does winter ale mean anymore anyway? Some breweries call a seasonal pale a winter ale and then sometimes you get a beauty like this. Well when it¬ís dark and cold this is my go to, and in my opinion this year¬ís is the best batch yet.

Probably one of my favorite winter seasonals.

Bottle. Dark ruby to deep brown in color, creamy tan head. Aroma is of roasted malt and brown sugar. Taste is similar, molasses, pepper. strong rich maltiness, complex hop overtone taste taste and finish. Creamy full bodied with apparent alcohol taste yet well balanced. Best to be consumed at an old age on the porch of a log cabin deep in the wilderness as you watch the snowfall with a loved one held close.

Pours dark ruby, off-white head with lots of lacing. Aroma is dark malt, molasses. Taste much the same, with a slightly hoppy element as well. Based on the appearance and smell, you¬íd expect it to be sweeter than it is. A nice full-body, moderate carbonation, nice mouthfeel. Very drinkable, even if the alcohol is hidden neither well nor poorly. Another good one from GD.
Decent, but there¬ís an off flavor. Dirty lines? Peppery, full flavored. A little boozy.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2013 Poured from bottle into snifter. Dark pour with not much of a head, and that quickly faded to a tiny ring, but a surprising amount of lace. Aromas are bread, coffee, roasty, barnyard, cheese, earthy and malt. Taste is rich malt, with a fine balance of sweet, bitter and smoky salt. Full creamy body and texture with hints of stickiness. Carbonation is lively. Long finish. A really, really nice winter ale, but if I didn¬ít know better I would guess this is a stout.
Would love to cellar some of this but not sure I could leave it alone to age!

Bottle. Poured a dark ruby brown color with a off-white head. Aroma was chocolate notes, maple sugar, alcohol. Flavor was fruity, dried fruits. Flavor was sweet, dried, pitted fruits. Malts. Pretty good, very warming.
Apple, pear, and melon aroma. Taste of apples, coca cola, and hints of caramel. Calvados is present in the aftertaste.
Aroma of roasted malts and cocoa, dark brown color. Taste of chocolate, slight coffee, and roasted malts with slight hops. Not much carbonation. Very very good beer

355ml bottle, hazy dark reddish brown colour, medium frothy mostly lasting beige head, excellent lacing. Aroma of lime, coal with notes of licorice, herbs and chocolate. Taste is initially sweet and slightly salty turning into a moderately bitter longish finish with a lightly astringent and alcoholic feel. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Very pleasant dark ale, didn¬ít seem that complex but it could be a bit too cold.
On tap at Medi¬ís. Dark brown color. Nice sweet brown sugar scent. Taste is caramely, kind of sweet and a little boozy. Good beer.

.33l bottle from Alko Keskusta 
Pours clear dark amber with high off-white head. Aroma is nutty. caramel, dark malts, dried fruits. R
Specially raisin. Flavor is alcohol, dark malts, dark fruits, nuts. Caramel notes and hops. Soft, dry palate. Very nice!

Pours very dark brown with a massive foam tan head. Aroma is rye bread, caramel, figs. orange zest, honey. Taste is rye bread, honey, caramel, figs. Not nearly as good as previous years¬í Hibernations. Haven¬ít rated til this year though.

Dark brown but clear beer with a very big and foamy beige head. A very faint aroma. Caramel sweetness, sweet bread, some coffee, medium bitterness and alcohol warmth. Somethin spicy aswell. Medium body, nice texture. A very drinkable and nicely balanced ale with character. A very good red ale.
Bottle. Brown with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Medium body with malt body and coffee notes upfront some hop bitterness and a dry finish.
bottle into glass, dark clear brown pour with thin white head, aroma of bitter malts, taste is whoppers candy, and cream finsh , this shits pretty dam good

330ml bottle labelled 8.7% ABV. Pours dark amber with a large foamy beige head. Aroma of caramel, plums and maple syrup. Taste of roasted malts, caramel, spices, maple syrup and alcohol. Light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, smooth texture, average carbonation. Overall a good Old Ale, but somewhat unbalanced with alcohol that is slightly too noticeable.

Mahogany brown and slightly reddish ale with really thick and bold head on top. Aroma has oak, slight chocolate, stingy berries and some herbs. Bold malty flavors, herbs and bitterness, with roasted malts, dark chocolate and oak. Medium bodied and medium carbonation. Nice beer to enjoy beside the fireplace.

12oz bottle (August 27 2013 date) - pours dark amber with tan head. Nose is coffee/chocolate and roasty. Sip adds wood or earth notes and nuts. Quite malty with roasted bitterness. Medium to big body. Yum. Slight resin aftertaste.

M√∏rk brunr√∏d farge med h√∏yt nydelig tykkt beige skum som legger seg som ett lokk over √∏len og blir liggende hele veien ned. Aroma av sjokolade, kaffe, karamell og stenfrukter som de mest fremtredende. Litt brent/r√∏k smak. Smaker ogs√• at denne √∏len har h√∏y alkoholprosent. God!

On tap at Tapwerks. Pours a clear dark amber brown with a gray head that dissipates quickly to the edges. Aroma has notes of sweet grains that are slightly earthy, toffee and just a hint of smoke. Flavor also has sweet grains and toffee and is backed by a slight earthy and smokey note.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Pours a dark brown with a dark ruby hue. Nice head of tan foam that laces well and has reasonable retention. Light nose of dark malt, molasses and piney hops. Medium body and carbonation level. The taste is complex and has dark malt (heavy on the chocolate), molasses and a hop undertone. Sweetness is present, but is almost hidden by roast malt bitterness. Alcohol is well hidden. On the finish, a nice oak flavor comes through and lingers along with a light hop flavor. Very good, but not outstanding.
From the bottle, pours dark mahogany with a beige head. Smoky and oddly spicy aroma. Malty flavor, neither sweet nor bitter. Good carbonation. Slightly bitter finish.
Red-brown colored. A smooth head that dissaperad quickly. Spicy aroma. Very sweet taste and fully bodied. A balanced bitter aftertaste. Some hints of fruit.

Excellent seasonal from Great Divide. I normally avoid these kind of ¬íwinter strong english ales¬í because I find them to be immensely boring. However, I took a chance on this one and it turned out be rich and dynamic. This is a campfire beer. Tastes like toffee, chestnut, smoked sausage, toasted pine, with a slight hint of ripe plum tomato. Abv gives it body, but does not come through in the taste. Very good, but only if you like big smokey beers.
Not the best Christmas brew I've had, but it's definitely rich enough in the palate, with some decent spices & sweetness.

Bottle, 355 ml - Clear red brown beer with a large beige head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, spices, chocolate, roasted oats and pine needles. Flavor is malty with notes of toffee, spices, orange and pine needles. Balanced and hearty but not as good as it normally is.

355ml bottle. Dark ruby colour and a medium sized, tan head. The aroma has notes of malt, fruits (plums & raisins), spices, hops and vegetables. Medium/heavy sweetness and somewhat bitter taste. Average body with quite soft texture and medium carbonation.

Heavy roasty coffee and alcohol flavors dominate. The dry hopping is noticeable. Not the most balanced beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not my type of beer. Don¬ít really like The smell of it. Great brewery but the old ale just isn¬ít my type. Good to know, this comes as a seasonal to Sweden.

Bottle from alko, j√§rvenp√§√§. Clear dark reddish brown color, smooth white head. Aroma is sweetness, plum, licorice, yeast, spices. Sweet and hoppy taste, balanced, licorice, spices, some berries. Dry hoppy finish with some spices.

Bottle. Dark mahogany colour. Big, thick, beautiful head.
Toasted malt, light chocolate, caramel, nuts, coffee and bit alcohol on aroma.
Taste is more roasted malt, nuts, coffee, chocolate, bit hoppy and woody with warming alcohol.
Medium+ bodied with very smooth mouthfeel and soft carbonation.
Finish is hoppy, sweet and roasted, medium dry and warming.
Fireplace ale.

Is Hibernation Ale new to Texas or something? I¬ím a big seasonal beer buyer and this would have definitely been on my winter shopping list if I¬íd had it before. Big bold and malty but with some nice piny hop notes. Could easily down too many of these.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2014 12 oz bottle from Evergreen Discount. Reddish brown appearance with a tan head and lacing. Rich with toasted malts, toffee, bitter hops, light chocolate and caramel. Medium sweetness. Pretty full body with a nice feel and a warming finish.  Update:  On tap, tasting real good, like 3.9 ish

Clear ruby with mahogany tone in mix, big creamy, beige head that leaves bit sticky lacing. Sweet aroma has both nice caramel malt and balancing hoppy pine notes, bit spices?. Inviting aroma anyway. Sipping this feels quite thick and heavy, has lots of warming alcohol, kicks bit in a good way, sweet flavor is malty and long lasting to finish, pine is there also. Still aroma is the nicer part here. Warming one for cold winter nights

355 ml bottle. Clear dark reddish brown colout, tan head. Aroma of toasted malt, dried fruits, earthy notes and a hint of alcohol. The aroma is roasted malty, with notes of coffee and fruits, and a dryish, slightly resiny hoppy finish with a little alcohol warmth. Good stuff.

355 ml, bottled. Pours clear dark ruby with a fine beige head. Aroma: Malt, cellar aroma, potato sack. Taste: Medium sweet, pleasant bitterness. Nice mild sour component. Palate: Near medium body, pleasantly bitter. Nice one, I will grab a couple more of these for cellaring.

Bottle. Pours a clear reddish brown with a light tan head. Aromas of toasty malt, chocolate, caramel and some spicing. Flavor is caramel, chocolate, light coffee, and spices- light bitter finish. Medium bodied, smooth with a lingering sweetness.

Bottle. Amber, hazy, average to large and mostly lasting head. Moderate to full, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light caramel and some tropical fruitiness, some piney hoppyness and light alcohol. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, light caramel and light roasted malt, light tropical fruitiness and some piney hoppyness, light alcohol. Finish is average to long, malty and lightly sweetish, light roasted malt and faint fruitiness, some piney hoppyness, some alcohol. OK aroma but finish almost totally lacks the fruitiness - finish has too much alcohol. Not too sweet though (due to alcohol and bitterness).

First old ale. Very good. Hides alcohol well. Smooth finish. Would definitely get again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep, opaque mahogany with reddish brown edges and a thinner khaki-tan head that leaves some splotchy, hanging lace. Really awesome complex malty nose involving toasted malt, almonds, milk chocolate, some gentle smoke, savory oak, cherries, dates, with some pine and tropical fruit hanging out in the background. A lot of sweetness in the flavor, also a pretty substantial bitterness. Heavy bodied, rich, syrupy, softer carb, toward tannic and drying, with a lingering woodsy bitter finish. Killer brew, so many good things happening. Just right strength-wise. Awesome.

2010-2013 Vertical

An extremely dark mahogany body flashes an occasional cherry highlight, capped by a 1.5" creamy khaki head with a frothy crown which dissipates within a couple minutes leaving a solid ring and dense smooth lacing fading to several erratic peninsulas and islands, each vintage offering a slightly shorter, more delicate head

2013 Bottled OCT 18 2013
Dark caramel, chocolate, and pecan pie accented with coffee and lightly tart baked apple, all meshing to suggest waves of dates, the creamy medium body presents a strong additional layer of roast which resonates and dries to create deeper dried dark fruit characteristics with hints of ash

2012 Bottled AUG 31 2012
Cherry and prune juice, berry nuances, fig, caramel chocolate pie, hints of peach cobbler, fruity sweet on a smoother, cleaner palate with a fairly nondescript finish, lightly colored fruit characteristics resonate, moving back to the 2013 vintage reveals amplified coffee aromatics

2011 Bottled AUG 31 2011
Subdued dark fruit characteristics with an earthy influence, baked yellow apples, integrated, subdued components with slightly spicy yeast esters on a silky smooth, almost syrupy medium palate, as the subtle flavors resonate and build, english tea and bland muffins come to mind, the roast quality from the fresh batch returns, very earthy and subtle compared to latest vintages

2010 Bottled NOV 24 2010
Overripe light fruit and toffee initially flood the senses, blending into a flash of white wine nuances, settling on brown sugar honey drizzled melon with peach accents on a smooth medium body, working back through the aromas of all four vintages, the fresh batch comes off as pungent coffee, fruity, overripe, caramel or toffee embossed aromatics are represented in the middle vintages, and the eldest¬ís matured sweet honey and brown sugar layer is unique

12oz bottles served at 55¬∫ into 16oz Spiegelau Soiree brandy snifters
Bottle. Nice, roasted flavor with lots of sweetness and quite boozy. Pretty malty, with a good balance. I get a bit of bit of plums and yeast as well. Refreshing finish.
This will definitely keep you warm while hibernating. That¬ís a lot of taste packed in a little bottle.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Deep brown color with a thick, frothy beige head. Strong complex aroma of dried fruits, raisin, malt and sour lemon. Sour, bitter taste. Bitter finish with quite a lot of alcohol coming through.
caramel, coffee, earthy, raisin, amber, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, thick feel, average carbonation,
Had this beer at a winter beer tasting at On the Rocks. My favorite. Rich, very malty, dark brown with some caramel and roasted malts.

The aroma is malt forward and very promising. Toffee, caramel, with hints of dried fruit. A clear mahogney pour with a one finger, mostly deminishing, tan head and dripping ringed lacing. The taste is moderately sweet. Roasted malts, caramel, dried fruit, coffee notes, and grain. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Round mouthfeel. Overall, this is a well crafted beer. Rich in flavor and enjoyment. Well done, Great Divide!

Draft. I like it. Hides the alcohol well. Has some roasty chocolate in here. Nice appearance and lacing. No warming of the belly. Just a nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled September 12, 2013 (2 months old).
Appearance: The body is clear with a deep garnet hue, such a nice color! the head is short and short lived, settling into a full tan coating with a creamy ring.
Aroma: The aroma is smokey, sort of like a cigar, very earthy, dry roast, sweet caramel and some cocoa. The aroma is bold and dry and slightly appealing.
Taste: Boy this is interesting, the intro is mildly sweet with some cocoa and caramel, smoke overlies it by the mid-taste though providing a flavor of just puffing a cigar. The cigar flavor is persistent with cocoa becoming more prominent, matching the cigar flavor, by the finish with a very slight fig flavor. The finish is dry and lingers of smoke, roasted coffee and roasted peanuts.
Palate: Full bodied with some bitey carbonation, I expected something more syrupy.
Overall: This is an interesting beer and much different than I remember. This is unlike any other beer I¬íve ever had except for Magic Hat¬ís Seance, this is like it¬ís older, bolder and bigger brother. Very well done.
Dark brown beer with large beige head. Aroma is alcohol, wood, spices. Flavor is wood, nuts, malt.
