UPDATED: NOV 10, 2013 Reddish-brown clear beer with a huge blonde head. Aroma is sweet with cocoa, chocolate, wood and spices. Taste is cocoa, chocolate and malty sweet. Finish is pretty long with alcohol warming up. Palate is pretty full and oily thick with low carbonation. Pretty enjoyable.
On tap. Pours a dark red/brown with light head. Aromas of malts and metal. Flavors of toasted malts, a bit of dark fruit, and light resin. Creamy

Pours brown with a hint of garnet; creamy-looking beige head that settles to short of a finger-width. Aroma is musty, smoky wood with a glimmer of darkfruit malt. Taste is similar - rich, aged oak; smoked coffee malts, molasses and some darkfruits. But there are hops too on the down-low. Aftertaste is a touch of hop bitterness, singed wood and alcohol. This beer has the taste of age. An interesting an complex libation. This is not for the vanilla types. Me likey.

Wow is this good!! Dark brown ale base, kinda, but there's a toffee and coffee thing going on from scent to taste. Strong, too. Wonderful. Just the right amount of hops. A truly unique brew. Solid A. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle. Pours a dark brown. Has a large amount of tan head with huge amounts of lacing. Lacing stays on glass the entire time while drinking. Has smells of caramel, nuttiness, smokiness and saltiness. Tastes like it smells.
Last drink of the night on draft at Mellow Mushroom Tempe, served in a heavy, chalice-like glass. Lots of flavor. To me it is like a brown ale and strong ale mixed. Interesting.

Cafe y chocolate tostado y maderas ahumadas. Color cafe oscuro con un degradado de caramelo, buena espuma, excelente trazo. Cuerpo robusto, final largo y dulce. Notas amargas y dulces con mucha malta.

Pretty good looking, dark brown but clear, light brown head started about an inch and settled at about a 1/8" creamy cap, with good lacing.

Aroma is more milk chocolate and coffee than I expected, tho I¬ím not completely sure what I expected. There¬ís a notable hoppiness and some alcohol in the nose too.

Flavor is a mixture of what to me seems like elements of various styles, porter, barleywine, brown ale, even a little touch of IPA, as the hops give it a real good tang.. Coffee again comes through in the flavor, as does a nice bit of milk chocolate, and a solid, moderately sweet, solid malt base.

Body is pretty substantial, carbonation is medium-low, which seems like it suits this beer well. Finish is sweet malts and lingering chocolate.

For not knowing what to expect, the one thing I did expect didn¬ít let me down: Great Divide makes great beer.
2013. Slight translucent dark brown pour some tan head. Aroma of wood, bbq, whole wheat bread. Tastes same + coffee. bittersweet and watery this one goes down smooth and easy.

Undated 12 oz bottle.
Murky, dark brown body is covered by a small head that manages to leave plenty of lacing. 
Aroma: sweet malts with ome dark fruits and hints of hops and roasted nuts.
Taste: the mix of seet, bitter and slightly sour turns mildly bitter by the finish. A lingering taste of earthy, roasted malts with just of touch of spciy hops.
Medium brown with aromas of caramel, chocolate, and figs. Body is nice and warm but over sweet. Alcohol in the finish. Beer is not the worst or best. Enjoyable though.
Bottle pour, dark orange-brown color with a tan head. Chocolate aroma, very malty upon pouring. Taste is very malty with a pleasant smoothness to it. Overall a good beer, heavy though.

Malty chocolate dark warm beer. Bottle. Not the easiest beer, which is why I like it .

Tap. Pours clear Burgundy, medium creamy tab head, nice lacing. Aroma is malt, caramel, toffee, peat, brown sugar. Flavor is medium sweet, bit of bitterness, touch of plastic, a bit smoky. Medium plus body, creamy.

Oh yeah! First day down in the low 60's and I needed a beer of substance. This was the perfect choice. Big malt flavor covers the higher than normal alcohol level. Deep, deep ruby tone with limited carbonation and its so smooth.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear amber brownish beer with s small layer on beige head on top. Aroma is very smokey, touches of sugar and honey (?). Flavour is very sweet and smokey, almost like sweet barbecue sauce poured over grilled ribs. Epic flavours on this one. Long sweet finish. Very nice brew.

Tap at Great Divide, Denver. Poured a murky dark brown with a frothy off white head. The aroma is roasted malt and coffee. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a liqourice roasted malt spicy fruit palate. A really flavour packed beer.
Draft at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is nutty, malt, caramel, bread. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Color is a deep ruby/brown with a foamy light tan head. Very nutty aroma, there¬ís some caramel, dark fruit, molasses, earthy, and slightly spicy. Nice dark fruits on the taste, plums and dark cherries, toffee, nutty flavor again, a little alcohol, caramel, and some floral hops. Not bad, the toffee and nutty flavor I felt came on too strong. Kind of a nice warming quality from the alcohol, unfortunately it¬ís still 90+ outside.
Rated from backlog. Aroma is caramel, toffee and mildly vinous. The flavor is caramel/toffee, mild notes of tart fruit, some sweetness and a mildly vinous, warming alcoholic finish.
If you want a big beer (8.1 - 8.7 abv )...that doesn¬ít taste like a BIG beer...this is your beer...malty, smooth...down right delish!!....enjoy!
355 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Clear deep amber with off white head. Aroma malty with caramel, earthy hops, floral and fruit. Taste is sweet and malty; caramel, earthy hops, fruit and alcohol.
I loved this malty ale. What a surprise. Hop flavors good. Ican¬ít say muchabout the aroma. I still don¬ít know why that matter in rating the beer.
Bottle. Tastes malty, smoky, sweet. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like molasses, syrup, malt.

It is a very complex beer. The aroma is strong and get a great smell of the flavors. Overall appearance is a darker amber color with a tan head. The taste is pretty complex. You get a strong malt taste with a nice spice finish. Overall a great beer. Strong flavorful aroma with a complex taste
Very hoppy aroma and flavor. Foamy, but that¬ís my fault. Oak. Caramel. Spruce.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown, bottled on October 23, 2012, bottle poured into a english pint glass.  Pours dark brown with crimson hue and small off-white head.  Little lacing, medium body, low carbonation, and off aroma.  Taste is robust heavy caramel malt, spice, quite a bit of herbal hops.  Not that great and heavy.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks avrashi. Ruby red colour, wine, deep berry and caramel aroma, tastes sweet in an alcoholic sort of way. No carbonation, full body, alcoholic finish. Not amazing.

2011 version.

A - Pours a dark ruby/garnet color with a light tan head

S - Bready and yeasty, toffee and caramel, strawberry. As it warms plums, sweet oaky bourbon, caramelized brown sugar. Bits of lacing.

T - Dense toffee malt, pecans, brown sugar, strawberries, notes of vanilla, citrus and mint hops bring in a crisp bitterness. A light caramel/maple sweetness coats the entire mouth while barley dominates the palate.

M - Full chewy body, crisp and smooth at different stages, warming.

This should be in a catagory of it¬ís own. I¬íve always that of this as a winter Barleywine. Start with a semi-cold one and let it warm completely. This beer really transitions and becomes complex when warm. I¬íve always had it fresh as it¬ís so hard to age because I always end up drinking it.

Serving type: bottle

11-20-2011

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks avrashi. Pours deep red with a beige head, aroma of honey, toffee, werthers original, rounded mouthfeel, flavor is roasted with dried fruits and chocolate, medium bodied

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks avrashi. Clear deep amber color. Malty aroma with caramel, a bit of earthy hops, slightly floral, and a bit of fruitiness. Sweet malty and caramelly flavor with a bit of hops bitterness, slightly stale, and a bit of fruitiness. Medium-bodied.
Pours dark reddish brown with a small cream head. Aroma of figs, brown sugar, caramel, spice, and molasses. Taste is light fruit, spice, figs, and caramel malt. Solid.
Looks like molten carmel.  Tastes sweet and smooth.  A pleasant surprise.  I like this a lot.  Great Divide ... Quality brews.
Brown/ruby body with a minimal white head. Aroma is spicy, some liquor, ripe fruits. Taste is malty, with a pleasant and moderate hoppy presence. Dry long finish

This beer¬ís aroma was strongly reminiscent of roasted malts and clove, and the appearance combined a brownish red color and a small off-white head. Indeed, these first impressions prepare you completely for the taste, which is quite sour, slightly sweet, and a touch umami, as well as the palate, full body, thin texture, soft carbonation, and long finish. Although it wasn¬ít be best beer out there, it was still really enjoyable and pleasant.
Lovely barley wine. Sweet smell and taste but it tastes very good it is almost as nice as a rochefort 10
On draft at Sharp Edge Brasserie. Poured deep brown with thin ring of lace. Minimal head. Dark fruity flavor; plums, raisins, figs, chocolate all present.  Dry, slightly bitter finish. Not my style.

355ml bottle, 2010 bottling, from cellar.
Pours a deep, brilliant copper, with a beige head.
Complex, spicy, mature aroma, malt, dried fruit, almonds, caramel, toffee, marzipan.
Off-dry, full bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Mature, complex taste, malt, caramel, marzipan, hops, hazelnut, dried fruits, figs.
Incredibly smooth and balanced, a fantastic beer to cellar for a few years. A truly hedonistic beer! (2013-03-29)

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2013 This one is great! Pours a dark amber with a fleeting head. Nice clinging lace around the glass. Aroma is nutty and of toasted malts. Taste is toasted malts and smooth, creamy nutty character. It¬ís somewhat sweet and only faintly bitter. The complexity of the finish on your palate as it fades is super nice. Yum! This is one of my favorite beers! Age it! it only gets better.
-vintages tried 2010,2011,2012,2013

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a small white head. Smell is malts and a bit alcohol. Taste is alcohol, some small nut and barley malts. Aftertaste is pretty long lasting and there is some small hop influens but what comes mostley is the alcohol what i think is not a bad thing in a Old Ale beer. It¬ís wery nice beer for a cold winter night like it is right now. Great Divide has never faild at least those beers i have tasted from them.

Pours clear amber with a lasting tan head. Aroma is of roasty malt and citrus-pine hops with some sweet vanilla and wood notes. Taste is very malty up front, with a full body that fades to a mix of roasted malt and citrusy hops. Nicely balanced and definitely a good beer for this (lasting) winter.

Bottle shared at Annies place. Pour was deep, dark brown with thin off white head. Creamy texture. Notes of fig, sweet malt, molasses, and some other dark fruits come out. Lacked depth but still a nice brew for a cold night. 3.4
Brown with fluffy head. The nose is burnt sugar/brown sugar and dates. The pallet is dominantly burnt sugar.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Color ambrato scuro con un velo soffice di schiuma biancastra. Aroma maltoso, denso e dolciastro con sentori fumosi, legnosi e caramellati; gusto complesso con note di toffee, frutta candita, malti tostati, cacao amaro, fumo e legno da botte. Corpo medio-abbondante, effervescenza debole, struttura oleosa e liquorosa; una ale favolosa!

Great Divides version of a 120 Minute IPA, this hits all the right notes. The sweetness from the malts come through, but it misses the smokey bourbon flavor that Dogfish has. This is a poor mans 120 Minute, but still enjoyable.

Pours a nearly opaque mahogany with a small off-white head and minimal lacing.  Aroma is malty, dark fruit, and chocolate.  Taste is caramel to start followed by some booziness and ending with chocolate and dark fruit.  Delicious beer.

Huge/intense malt flavor. No head. No lacing. Beautiful clear super dark coper color. Admittedly, had this after two IPAs, but this beer seemed so malty I only needed/wanted a small amount - it was very rich. Flavor is good but a little went along way. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour from a 12oz bottle. Six pack bought at a World Market in Cleveland. Clear dark brew with small tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, a little earth, a little spice, alcohol. Taste is sweet toffee, earth, dark fruit, a little vinous tartness, notable boozey / vinous finish. Warm going down, potent stuff.

Bottle at home. Aroma is of raisins, figs, chocolate, sherry. Full bodied and viscous. Has a mix of fresh red fruit and dried fruit flavors, light smoke, wood, sherry. Very slight roast malt and chocolate leading into the finish. Excellent.
Aroma is caramel, toffee and mildly vinous.  The flavor is caramel/toffee, mild notes of tart fruit, some sweetness and a mildly vinous, warming alcoholic finish.

Pours hazy, wood-red-brown with a thick tan head.
Scent is richly malted, light roast chocolate.
Taste is sweetly nutty,.....malty, caramel, spice, dark fruit.
Extremely enjoyable stuff.

Pours a deep ruby brown. Lacing all the way down the glass. Roasted malts. Sweet. Spices. Favorite winter seasonal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours a deep ruby red, slight haze, beige head good retention. Smells of rich roasted malts, very slight hops, and chocolate- very subtle. Tastes very rich - chocolate, roasted caramel malts, slight smoke. Feels full and chewy. Great beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Greatest of all the winter ales!
Better each year. Only wish I could get it here in TN. Would love to try the barrel-aged



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice light brown foam, rich dark smell with caramelly scents. Dark but still a nice color to it.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 Chocolate, caramel, and bready notes delight the nose, this beer smells incredible! Sweet caramel and earthy / spicy hops followed by a smooth rich mouth feel rounds out huge flavor that is pleasantly warming. I can¬ít believe this beer is sold in six packs.

Enjoyed on tap at Wild Monk. Served in a snifter.

A: Pours a dark ruby/light brown combination with an off white head forming on the pour. Great retention has it slowly recedes down the glass. Sticky sheets of lace are left behind.

S: Light, roasty malts with a little dark fruit. Creamy sugar with a touch of chocolate.

T: Dark fruits with an underlying malty sweetness. A little complimenting alcohol. Slightly nutty with some unsweetened chocolate and just a touch some mineral-like yeasty notes.

M: Surprising light in body for an old ale, but it¬ís pretty drinkable for that reason. Mediumish bodied with a medium carbonation level.

O: I¬ím more of a fan of the leathery, highly malted old ales. This was one was just a tad light more for, me it still had nice flavors and was pretty drinkable.

Serving type: on-tap

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 Beautiful beer... dark brown/amber, foamy tan head.  A tiny bit of coffee, tiny bit of fig aroma, with malt and definitely some alcohol. Taste is quite complex; fig, earthy hops, malt and dark chocolate.  Has an old basement essence to it.  Palate has an alcohol burn, mellow and the bubbly head sticks around.  It¬ís like a hybrid of a -bock or amber ale and a bourbon stout.  Good.

Copper brown with small light tan head.  Aroma fresh pine hops, strong brown sugar background.  Medium full body.  Pleasant alcohol warming.  Flavor is a strong and mostly balanced mix of bitter hops and sweet malts.  Actually thought it was a little better on the cold side, as it warms it gets a little too sticky and the hops balance fades.  Very good regardless.

The aroma is primarily malts.  The pour is a reddish brown with a tiny white head that does not leave lacing.  The taste is a deep and complex blend of malts and hops.  They are intertwined beautifully as the taste goes from malt to hop back to malt and leaves a bitter finish on the tongue.  It¬ís slightly thick and a touch chewy but the 8.7% doesn¬ít overpower the flavors.  Pretty deep beer!
roasted flavors that are strong and flavorful.... could only drink one because of this though...high alcohol content that can be tasted...takes away from taste a bit
Bottle. Pretty amber with crimson to orange tints. Nose of caramel, fudge, port. Aged flavor, slightly oxidizes, with caramel, earthy hops, nice fudge. Dry. Good drinking.

Aged 2 years, 3 months (2010 vintage): Wow, there was alot of yeast (and/or other beer stuffs) sediment that poured out of the bottle.  I¬ím having to let the glass sit for a while just so I can get it to settle so I don¬ít get a mouthful of it.  After letting it settle, it now looks like the caked dust you¬íd find on computer fan blades or outside neglected air conditioning filters.  It¬ís dark brown in color, very muddy in appearance, with an off-white head.  Despite how ugly this beer is, it smells great!  It reminds me of sweet, sticky maple syrup, raisins, and spiced cake.  The flavor tastes so much like fresh, unfermented wort from partially roasted malts that it¬ís easy to forget you¬íre drinking an Old Ale, let alone anything fermented.  It has become very soft and dull with a pasty smoothness that seems to be all thanks to the heavy suspension of caked matter that¬ís formed over the years.  As the supernate forms, the body almost begins to turn a garnet color.  It¬ís definitely interesting, but I think two-plus years is a little too much for this beer.  My advice: drink before two.

Draft at craft ale house. Pours dark reddish brown with a small off white head. The aroma Is very malty with some caramel, nuts, and light vanilla. The taste is nutty, some caramel, some chocolate maybe. Very nice big brown ale

Complex aroma - malt, caramel, slight hopiness even.  Copper color with very little head.  Very woody/earthy up front, slight sweetness, then a bit of a piney finish.

2011 bottle. Nice clear deep red color with a small off white head. Aroma is berries, cherries, sweet caramel, toffee, bisquits, some booze. Taste is sweet caramel, toffee, bisquity, some raisins, dark fruits, bisquity, candy, not much bitterness left from the fresh bottle. Nice, sweet, malty, winter warmer.

Tap. Pours dark ruby with thin, creamy off-white head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is cookie and bread malts, figs, dates, plums, floral hops, and light booze. Flavor is lightly sweet malts, grassy and floral hops (light bitterness), and dark fruit esters, and herbs; dry finish with light bitterness. Medium body and low carbonation.
2010 draft. Almost black, brown head. Aroma of burnt nutella. Taste is amooth tawny port. Boy, has this one evolved nicely!

12 ounce bottle.  "Bottled on Oct 3, 2011" and purchased shortly thereafter at Best Damn Beer Shop ($2.49).  Pours a nice red-purple-brown color with one finger of light tan foam.  Aroma of sticky candied fruit from a holiday fruitcake, cardboard, caramel, chalky vanilla, coconut, and a hint of cherry.  Flavor of dark toffee, more candied dark fruit, molasses, light chocolate, and some pancake syrup.  Rather sweet and shows the booze a little bit, but still goes down easy enough.  Though I aged it more than a year before drinking, I suspect laying it down even longer would help.  (1355, 763)

Been drinking this for well over a decade and didn't get around to rating it. Nice to see it back home in Chagrin. Bottle: pours clear, dark ruby brown, fluffy tan head that settles to a dense head of foam. Impressive looks and fair amount of lacing. Nose is nutty, roast, bread, some maple and possibly oak hues, toffee and subtle mocha coffee touches as well. Once on the palate, lots of nutty notes, molasses, coffee, toffee, flat cola and hints of brown sugar. Finish is somewhat coffee bitter as well as warming with some alcohol. Smooth palate and quite good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Enjoyed on tap at the Wild Goose in Chicago, IL prior to seeing Zero Dark Thirty.  Appearance is a dark, thick caramel with a rich white head that laces to the glass.  Aroma is very rich in caramel malt, snells boozey, pretty much like a barley wine.  Taste is less abrasive than a barley wine and goes down pretty smooth, with dark fruit and caramel malt notes.  Very enjoyable, quality brew.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2013 Pours a deep, dark red with great lacing.  Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, cherries, with a balanced blend of hops, roast, and alcohol.  Flavor is roasted malts and a little hop bitterness, with a tiny bit of alcohol.  Complex, warming, and unique.  Lively carbonation with a great aftertaste.  Very, very drinkable and perfect for winter.

Deep Brown color. Slightly bitter, but not in a bad way. Tasty.                       

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0.335l from Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Colour is reddish brown with tiny brownish head. Aromas and flavours are sweetness, fruits, nuts and caramel. Quite "barleywinish".
Growler to taster. Looks good; a semi-transparent brown with off-white lacing. Smells sweet, malty, and a little boozy. Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel. Enjoyable.
Growler. Pours brown minimal head. Big nut aroma. Taste is thick sweet lots of roasted nuts and brown caramel sugar and toffee
Pours brown with a nutty, rye aroma. Nutty and malty flavor but a bit syrupy. Lightly spiced.

Pours amber with a thin khaki head that disappears to a film. Aroma has nice sweet roasted malt caramel toffee and vanilla and tootsie roll. Taste is more of the above with a good fizzy carbonation and subtle bitterness. Palate is slick and finished dry

On tap deep amber pour off white head that dissipates. Sweet malty aroma. Caramel malts. Light spice character. Very inviting aroma. Malty and booze with a bitter finish on the end. Good hardy winter beer for a cold day but not as complex as I was hoping for.

Pours a clear ruby brown on tap with pillowy tan head and light lacing. Aroma is odd, dust, dirt, kind of rubberry, with hints of acetone. Taste is better, roasted malts mask the acetone and rubber, but dustiness still comes through. Weird, dry finish, with a sweetness and burn on the way down. Interesting, but not really good.

Bottle- Pours a mahogany color with a decent head that fades to nice lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, some dark fruit, bit of spice and hint of chocolate. Taste of roasted malt, dark fruit and some chocolate Nice bitterness and a clean dry finish. Medium body, smooth and creamy. Has a nice richness and flavor is enhanced as it warms. No real hint of the 8.7% ABV. A good beer to curl up with on a cold night. An enjoyable sipper to get you the winter season.
Dark brown with small head. Nutty and malty aroma. Full mouthfell and nice bitterness, well balanced.

Good smell, taste also wonderful and the finish is fine when it is left for a while. Could easily imagine myself buying this but it would need something special to reach the top. Lite akolhol taste, I feel off. Minimal.
Very bready, worty and mellow with a hint of barley wine. Recommended to take before or after food.

Pours dark amber with thin bone colored head.  Initial aroma is very malty and toffee.  Malt, toffee, caramel, wood - wonderful balance of malts and hops throughout.  Earthy brew perfect for the winter.  A seasonal favorite.

Bottle poured. Rich brown color with a thick tan head. Moderate carbonation. Very nutty roster malt flavor. Sweet hoppy aroma.  Roasted almond flavor. Reminds me if an English brown more than a standard ale. 

-- cheers

12oz bottle.  Pours a mahogany brown color with a two finger tan head and lots of sticky lace. Mild hop aroma with notes of vanilla, cinnamon, sweet alcohol, and wood.  Taste opens with rich malty flavors that flow into bitter chocolate, caramel and finish with a burst of hops and coffee. A very strong beer with lots of character. Mouth feel is smooth, rich, and soft with slight carbonation.

Bottle at home (Beermongers, Portland OR) 26/12/12.
Pours a slightly obscured dark chestnut brown with reddish hues and a thin tan head that immediately dissipates to fine edgeing and a whisp of film in the centre.
Nose is dark fruits, sticky toffee pudding, sugars, light fart.
Taste comprises toffee, light coffee, figs, dates, dark sugars touch spice.
Medium bodied with bite, soft carbonation, sweet, dry and a little alcohol in the finish. Ok stuff, improved as it warmed.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Thanks to mike12da. Spicy, cinnamon, fumes, hops, and sugary coffee in the nose. Reddish-brown color, thin head. Light sugary sweetness; mid has some interesting earthy, raw soil, notes, and some dark grain cereal. final holds some bitterness and then goes sweet and smoothly down. Medium-thick body. Has a sort of schwarzbier-like chocloate character.
Bottle. Very little head. Medium aroma .alcohol , roasty, woody. Smooth on the tongue. Nasal burn on the swallow quickly dissipating. Warming. Perfect after winter chores!

Tap 2 blocks from the brewery at the "Whisky Bar". God was this good. Hits you like a freight train with its warmth and maltyness, but the dry hop does wonders. Exactly what a christmas beer should be like. caramel, roasty, chocolate aroma, with the taste to kick with a fresh finish. Epic. Just epic.
12oz bottle pours a dark ruby color with tan head. Carmel and brown sugar aroma. Great Christmas ale.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 Probably my favorite seasonal.  Can¬ít wait for it to come out every year and horde it before it goes off the shelves to last the winter...if I have extra, so be it...it ages well.  Mahogany brown, light head, pretty good lacing.  Nose of dark toffee, caramel malt, some dark dried fruit.  Flavor of tobacco (esp. on draft) and dried fruits and earthy malt.  Killer with aged gouda.
Bottle. Dark amber reddish. Sweet malts, raisins, dark fruits. Body is fullish. Dark fruits, some roasted malts. Some nuttyness. Smooth. Nice old ale.-- bb/h
Pours dark copper with tanned head.Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, fruit. Taste of burnt sugar, fruit, roasted caramel malt, spices. Sweet in the beginning and dry bitter finish.

Bottle pour. Pours amber with a thin khaki head that disappears to a film. Aroma has nice sweet roasted malt caramel toffee and vanilla and tootsie roll. Taste is more of the above with a good fizzy carbonation and subtle bitterness. Palate is slick and finished dry.

Brown colored with small amount of white head. Malts and hops well balanced, with a pleasant spiciness that is mild in the background. Good mouthfeel and crisp finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap.  Nice spice flavor with some strong alcohol burn.  Pretty good overall and great for winter.

Big ol¬í rich sipper. Full body, lots of mellow toffee overtones a hint of fruitcake, some nuttiness and a fairly bitter finish. Alcohol is a little evident. Not so lively, but a great fireside type of beer to while away the evening.

From bottle. Pours deep amber. Sweet aroma of fruit, sweet malt and toasted goodness. Taste follows with a sweet fruitiness, malt and finishes with a warm alcohol and hop bitter. A wonderful winter warmer and may be a first place for me for that category.

Pours red with a thin head. Aroma of caramel, cherries, brown sugar, vanilla. Taste is aroma with a sweetness on the tongue. Palate isn¬ít too thick and is a bit warming. A really nice winter seasonal in the old ale style.

Aroma was malty and creamy with cocoa notes. Taste was malty sweet with bitter chocolate notes. Also had some gentle hop to it. Poured a deep dark red with a large caramel head. Palate was thick, but not due to high carbonation.

Dark brown pour with a creamy oil slicked light tan head. Malt strong aroma with an oak, syrup and bourbon backing. Very toasty malt flavor with some nuts and dried fruit. Medium body but a nice hearty finish. Another really good beer from Great Divide.

Aroma: The smell is earthy, dried peas, hay, dark bread and brown sugar.Appearance: The beer is clear dark red with hints of brown, a tan head with unevenly sized bubbles, some lacing and good curtains.Taste: Initially sweet nuances from bread, dark syrup, burned crust, dates, nuts, then some short fruit acidity, pears and mango, and a bitter finish in the coffee bean area.Palate: Medium carbonation, a thick oily feeling, a heavy body and slightly dry finish.Overall: A solid slow sipping beer after dinner.Note: bottle Reviewed 2010-11-15.

Fairly hoppy for a winter warmer - hops apparent in the aroma and flavor. Dark roasty malt notes without the coffee flavors of a stout. A good beer, although personally I prefer less hops in winter warmers.

12 ounce bottle, bottled on September 5, 2012.  Served in a pint glass, the beer pours a clear ruby red/brown color with a half-inch light tan head that stayed around for a little while.  There¬ís a lot of lacing, too.  Aroma is nice, it¬ís smells like toasted malt, dark bread, dark fruit, caramel, brown sugar and some chocolate and coffee.  It tastes like dark fruit, caramel, dark bread, nuts, molasses, light smoked malt and chocolate.  Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, it¬ís creamy and coating with moderate carbonation.  I think it¬ís a good brew, I know I¬íll buy this again!  $1.99 for a single bottle.
A nice dark ale to be enjoyed both at dinner time and by it self at the fire place
Draft. Ruby, off-white head. Nose is sweet malts, gingerbread, chocolate. Taste is sweet malts, chocolate, Christmas spices. Chocolaty bitter finish.
Bottle from Systembolaget. 30 SEK. Blind tested yesterday evening at the yearly Winter/Christmas seasonal brew testing. A bit sweet. Would maybe be even better after some aging.

Pours a clear ruby with a thin soapy head.  Raisin notes in the aroma.  Some dark fruit sweetness with some burnt toast malty flavors that fades away into a bit of a charcoal bitterness at the end.  Interestingly complex, definitely a "warm" feeling great winter beer.

Aroma is slightly hoppy but very inviting. Pours a dark amber color. Very balanced between the hops and malt very complex flavor. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oak, pine, hops, some caramel and vanilla. Great English ale. Fantastic.   


    

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear influence from the hops, the alcohol cuts through a bit. The almost sawmill aroma gives a nice character.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is sweet and fruity, taste is round and toasty. A great fall/winter brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Love this wonderful nutty ,malty old ale.Perfect ale for late fall into the winter.Great escape from the crazy piney hoppy IPA¬ís I adore.

From bottle. Pours a crisp clear ruby with off-white head. Smells of floral hops and malt. Tastes malt forward with a bit of floral and english hop flavors, a little bitterness hits the tongue but it has a sweet finish.

A - Dark amber color with great legs that stick to the glass.  P- Not much head, but outstanding creamy texture on the palate without coating.  T - Nutty, slightly sweet bourbon hint, subtle seasonal spices with great finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2012 Bottle from Systembolaget, 2012 vintage
Pours dark red/brown with a small off white head.
Aroma is filled with toffee and sweet malt, sugar, some raisins and figs, alcohol and chocolate.
Taste has , roasted malt, toffee, dark fruits, sweet notes, chocolate, some smoky notes, bitter hops as well. 
Dry aftertaste with some bitter hops.
Oily mouth feel, medium carbonation.
A complex one that ages well!

12 oz. bottle poured into a Great Divide Brewing Company branded snifter.

Pours a beautiful dark amber with deep jewel-like burgundy hues. The two and a half finger head is cream-colored with excellent retention. Significant wispy lacing. A lot of chocolate on the nose, some booziness, dark fruit and toffee as well. Such a complex brew. A lot of fruit notes initally, black currant, black cherries, plum, caramelized raisins. Chocolate, biscuity accents, and hints of sherry show up midpalate. Bittering hop kick and phenol alcohol join in and carry through the finish. Smooth, silky, full body with low to medium carbonation. Hibernation Ale is a wonderful brew, complex, satisfying, and supplies everything you might be looking for in an old ale. Highly recommended.

Pours a murky copper brown with no head. Aroma of malt, caramel, chocolate and alcohol. Taste is malt, caramel, slight hop bitterness. Not great

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 vintage. 12 ounce bottle. 8.7% ABV. Pours a dark reddish-brown color topped by a thick buubly beige head. Rich chocolate malt aroma with hints of smoky peat. Smoky roasted malt flavor with lots of burnt caramel, peppery hops and complex maltiness. Soft mouthfeel makes  this a very drinkable ale, but beware of the high alcohol prescence. Outstanding.

(Bottle). 8,7% ABV. Prominent sweet malty aroma with hints of brown sugar, figs and hops. The taste is softly sweet with balanced flavors of malt, figs, brown sugar, raisins and hops. The aftertaste is a bit salty. A palatable and pleasant beer!
(The edition of 8.1% ABV was not as good as this, rating 636412)

Bottle 355 ml, BBE 01/10/2013. Dark brown, thin tan head. Nutty, some light malty sweetness in aroma. Sweet, some wood and light smoke in taste. Quite dry finish. Tasty, even if it feels a bit boozy in aftertaste.

Pours dark brown. Nice malty toffee like aroma. Taste reveals some smoky porter like notes. Nice alcohol bite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 A reddish dark brown color with a big frothy head. Aroma is very roasty with notes of chocolate, toffee and coffee. Taste is malty and roasted, very stoutlike. Flavours of chocolate, coffee, nuts. Low bitterness, low carbonation - soft mouthfeel. Medium to full bodied, smooth texture. Alcohol is hidden very well. Nice, enjoyable warming old ale/stout.

Single bottle to a pint glass. Dark amber pour, small white head. Aroma of roasted malts, toffee, and something mossy/earthy in the background. Taste is heavy on the malt with some caramel and a little dried fruit. Medium body. Good stuff.
Bottled. Pours dark amber with a small brown head. Smells cheese nutty malty, abit figs and raisins. Tastes abit coffee, abit chocolate and roasted malt, abit sweet with a similar finish.
Complex flavor here, lots of different notes. I get coffee, molasses, nuts, wood, and a little bit of fruity hops underneath. Good beer.

Bottle poured a hazy brown-orange hue w/ a fully diminishing light khaki head and excellent lacing. Medium aromas of dark fruits, brown sugar, peat, toffee, caramel, oak, and vanilla. Flavor is a moderate sweet initially with a light bitter finish. Tastes are peaty molasses, brown sugar, dark fruits, dark roasted malt, dark coffee, oak, toffee, vanilla and smokey. Full bodied, soft carbonization, creamy texture and a light alcoholic feel.

355ml bottle @Kaisla.  Dark amber colored, thin, but lasting head. Aroma has malt, raisins, toffeeish sweetness. Flavor similar, dark fruity, sweetish malty and caramel, long lasting finish that has raisins and light spicyness. Very balanced, warming, tasty beer. Great!
Clear, dark amber pour with a tan head. Aroma - piney hops, toasted malt,  brown sugar. Big flavor - malt, mild hops, vanilla, roasted nuts, alcohol. Aftertaste is sugary and just a little bitter.

Dark amber with a small, tan head. Aroma of caramel, dark fruits, mint.
Complex taste of dark fruits, smoke, wood. Light bitterness and some alcohol.

Bottle into a goblet. Pours dark ruby amber with a bit of bubbly head that fades to a halo and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is corn, spice, vanilla, bit of a whiskey nose. Taste is sweet, bitter, dark fruits. A bit of cranberry, raisins, caramel, and cough drop though without being artificial. Finishes bitter and woody.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 Poured a clear cola color with a light tan head. Aroma is nuts, chocolate, coffee, roasty, and cocoa. Taste is chocolate, nuts, cocoa, with a tinge of bitterness to round it out. Feels medium bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle at bar. Brown color, beige head. Roasty taste with lots of nuts, almond, malts, coffee and toffee. Malty finish with toffee. Great old ale.

Great aromas of aged oak, smoked barley, and roasted brown sugar. Deep crimson brown in appearance with no foam. Fresh hop assertiveness with complex flavors of herbs, caramel, clove, barley and wood. The finish offers a bit of a creamy caramel/oat flavor with a heavy alcohol sting. Overall, it¬ís really well done. Fantastic complexity and heavy on the booze. I¬íd give this an A+ rating.

Had this at a tasting over the weekend.  Amber-brown with a thin head on top.  This is rich and malty; thick in the body, with bitter citrusy hops in the finish to counter some of the malt.  Flavors of wet grain, thick caramel, nuts, and varying vegetation notes.  Not really my thing but overall not too bad.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber with a slight brownish head. Nose is malty with dried fruit and chocolate. Mouth is much of the same with some caramel too. in the nose. Not really as good ad I hoped for.

Pours a deep yet clear amber with a minimal beige head.  Aroma is of earthy malts, figs, chocolate, and raisin.  Much more chocolate comes out in the taste.  Nuts, caramel, and vanilla are present as well, although I¬ím missing the fruits that I detected in the nose.  Full in body with a thick texture.  Softer carbonation, with an aftertaste of nuts and chocolate.  I usually like Great Divide.  But overall, this one isn¬ít for me.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2012 On tap at Whole Foods at Market Square in Reston, VA. Board lists ABV at 8.2%. Clear, very dark mahogany with light khaki head and excellent lacing. Aroma of dark fruits (raisins, black mission figs, et al), brown sugar, peat, toffee, caramel, oak, vanilla and a touch of hops. Taste of peaty molasses, brown sugar, dark fruits, dark roasted malt, dark coffee, oak, vanilla and a hint of hops. Full/medium body and low/medium carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Shared from a 12 oz bottle at home.  Pours a clear dark reddish brown with an off white head.  Toffee aroma.  Dark red cherries and caramel notes.  Quite a lovely beer.
From a bottle. Pours slightly reddish brown. Flavor is nutty roasted and malted. Not my style but quite well crafted.

Clear dark amber with a generous fluffy cream-white head and very nice lace. Big grassy hops aromas with toasted malt characteristics and hints of overripe fruit. Toasted malts dominate the flavor profile, almost like an english strong ale, with fruit sweetness offset by bitterness of the grassy hops. Medium to full body, understated carbonation, creamy smooth mouthfeel, and a sweetish finish.

Tap flight at House of Beer.  Chestnut brown pour with a ram light foam head. Fig and rum raisin nose. Taste is a lot like coffee liqueur. Not what I was expecting.  Cognac-like.   Strong start but finish is a little flat.

Draft at Holy Grail Plano TX. Poured  dark brown with a big creamy head. Malty chocolate nose. Taste is very rich, sweet, velvet smoothness. Not chewy but creamy. A bit of alcohol just right for a winter warmer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Pours a clear and very dark amber with minimal head.  Aroma is sweet with roasted malt, caramel, mild fruitiness and also some nuttiness present.  Taste is roasted malt with dark fruit and some faint bitterness.  Nothing really dominates the flavor profile and things are well balanced.  The body is medium and the finish is on the dry side.  Now that it has warmed a little I am noticing toffee notes in the aroma.  A decent beer especially on a cold night.

Pours a nice brown dark color with a light tan head that doesn¬ít last too long. Aroma is sweet with vanilla, malt, caramel and fruit. Flavor is sweet and a little spicy with notes of dark fruit, vanilla and caramel with a nice bitter sweet finish. Body is medium overall and decently carbonated but not overly. A great beer I would definitely drink again.

2010 Vintage bottle
Appearance - Deep ruby, thick billowy white head
Aroma - Toffee, vanilla, malt, hops, bread
Taste - Sweet malts, caramel, brown sugar, light hops

This beer had huge flavors, and was pretty filling with just one bottle. I would definitely pick this one up again - tis¬í quite the warm-up brew.

Bottle.  Clear light brown pour, small ring of carbonation and an aroma of rich malt and raisins.  Flavor is also a nice rich malt, nuts and light caramel and a little wood on the finish.  Nice beer and well balanced for almost 9%.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a pint glass. Pours a nice deep amber with little to no head. Heavy roasted malt aroma taste is a nice toasty flavor with a noticeable hop prescience.  Leaves a slight dry bitter aftertaste. The alcohol is definitely present in the taste. A perfect beer for a cold evening.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle)  Pours a clear crimson color with a thin off-white head that retains and leaves quite a bit of lacing.  Aroma holds a pleasant scent of peanut brittle, prunes, light orange zest, and dark chocolate.  I¬ím not smelling it so much in this bottle, but it other bottles I¬íve had there¬ís been a vegetal scent of celery, so this bottle is much better.  There¬ís also a bit of nuttiness that¬ís independent of the brittle that takes on the scent of hazelnuts.  Maybe some light mocha.  Flavor holds plenty more of the brittle character, with strong toffee to back it up.  A bit of dark fruit like plum flashes in on the mid.  The finish dries out on a slight toasty and roasty note, with some light roasted coffee, roasted nuts, and the ever so faint bitterness of hops at the very end.  Mouthfeel is full and carbonation is mellow.  The 8% never makes its presence known.  Overall this is a well done old ale that has earned its place alongside my regular Winter beer rotation of Lake Superior Old Man Winter Warmer and Avery Old Jubilation.

Pours a clear, dark brown color with no head.  Mildly sweet aroma consisting of toffee, light caramel malt, light chocolate, dark fruit, and bread.  Taste is malty and smooth.  The flavors are all very subtle and not in your face.  It¬ís fairly sweet but not syrupy or cloying.  Don¬ít detect hops at all really unless that¬ís what¬ís adding the light fruitiness.  Medium body, slick mouthfeel.  This is a pretty good sipper that is just subtle and smooth.  This could cellar well I think.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a somewhat small head to it. Nose is very rich and malty - huge amounts of smells are coming off this beer. Taste is a little bit roasted, which makes for an inviting drink. Good winter.

Pours dark clear amber brown. Very light head that dissapates quickly. Aroma of malt, toffee, acetone, wet dog, biscut-y-ness. Flavor malt-forward with some bittersweet caramel notes. Slight brown sugar sweetness. Surprising hop bite on this one. Maybe just a hint of smoke? I could see having this sitting next to a fire on a cold day. After my first Old Ale style experience (i think it was a bad bottle), this one will make me seek out a few more of the style. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep amber with a thin, quickly evaporating tan-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, toffee, dark fruit, but also somewhat light and not syrupy. Taste is heart; big, boozey, grass, dark fruit, apples, hoppy citrus, bready, sweet but not too much so. Little to no lacing. Medium-bodied; not too really oily. This is nice. I like it.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2012 Pours red brown with minimal head. Aroma of coffee chocolate pine wood nuts and citrus. Taste is spicy and sweet bitter. Great divide all the way ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fruity syrup sweet aroma. Pours a dark amber. Slight woody flavor with a sweet finish. Just a hint of bitterness. Malty and robust just like it says on the bottle. Full flavored.

A true winter warmer. From start to finish this beer delivers. Rich, chocolate nuances, woodsy aroma with complex roasted flavors. Thick head leaving a nice white lace on my glass.  Hibernation finishes on the palate with a citrusy hop character and goes down inparting a warming effect through the body that makes cold winter nights some of the best.

Bottle @ Oluthuone Leskinen. Pours auburn with a medium dark beige head. Aroma is caramel, light nuttiness, some resin. Taste begins strongly caramel, dry, not sweet, strong nuttiness there as well. Some resin, turns a bit wooden on the finish. Palate is full, a bit stingy. Very quaffable and enjoyable.

On tap at the brewery. Pour is deep amber with a small, off-white head and decent lacing. Roast, brown sugar, Christmas spice, potpourri, straw, and caramel in the aroma. Flavors of espresso, roasted malt, candi sugar, orange peel, and bread with light bitter finish. Sticky mouthfeel with medium carbonation. A lot of malt and sweet flavors, but they are balanced well with spice and earthy tones. Nice brew.

Bottled a week ago. reddish amber pour, off white head (small) Aroma of tootsie rolls and caramel. Tastes kind of like a dead IIPA without everything that sucks about a 5 month old IIPA. Rich, malty, chewy, good carbonation. Not fucken bad.

What does a 5 year old hibernation taste like? Why would I keep a beer for 5 years that I have never rated? 12oz bottle, keep in the fridge for the last year or two. 2007 vintage. Malty, fruity, moderately oxidized. Malty sweet with a somewhat plump aftertaste. Brownish color with a wispy head. I have kept all the dregs in the bottle, which account for an ounce or two, will drink the rest afterwards. This is a beer that has held up well, but probably would have been better a year or two ago. In the end, I think the beer is showing a similar version of what it did new, it is a malt centric, moderately high gravity beer. It was likely never svelte.

This is one intense beer. Aroma is mostly hops, but the palate is evenly shared with extreme malts, hops and heat. It¬ís tasty, but over the top. My palate was a bit tired by the end of one bottle. One should be careful when pairing this with food - it¬íd probably go well with braised meat or a winter stew, but might overpower anything else.

Bottle. Fruity spiced tea, carob, and earthy root aroma. Cloudy burnt orange amber with a small tan head, suspended chunky sediment.  Fruity carob malt and earthy hops flavor. Full body, flat carbonation.

A-- Poured a dark reddish brown color. A solid 1 finger head once it settled and left a thick foamy lacing.

S-- Hops, malt, carmel, toffee, and some fall/ winter spices. Great fall/ winter smell.

T-- Well balanced between the hops and malt.

M-- Medium bodied and the flavor hangs around for a while. Get a little burn at the end but it is a good burn. Never get the sugar until the mouthfeel. Taste grows on me the more I let it sit. Always a good thing.

D-- A little big but always drinkable. Very well balanced and complex. One of my favorite winter beers and always look forward to seeing it come out. I guess that makes it very drinkable. How quickly can I finish this growler and then get another?

Taken from old notes. Sweet nose with notes of caramel. Taste is hop forward with a solid malt backbone. English hops blend well with the sweet malts to make a very nice old ale. Long bitter aftertaste.

A - Pours a dark amber-brown color with a finger of frothy tannish head. The head fades down at a normal pace leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is a mix of deep caramelized malts with some dark fruits, molasses, residual sugars, and some booze.

T - Starts off with lots of rich sweet caramelized malts with some raisin, fig, and other dark fruits. Through the middle, some molasses and other residual sugars come through with some light chocolate flavor. The finish is a mix of sweet caramelized malts with some dark fruit and booze.

M - Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth and slightly thick with a warming and sweet finish.

D - Very drinkable. Nice old ale with a great big malty profile. Nice overall balance with a good amount of body to hold up the strong flavors.
brown/amber color, aroma of cinnamon, chocolate, coffee, flavors of cinnamon, chocolate, coffee, toffee, dark fruits, pine hops, creamy texture, slightly dry finish, very enjoyable brew

Backlog nov/dec 2010.
On bottle at Olympen
Dark color, some foam.
Full body & complexity.
Dried fruit aromas and some sweet taste
Ok beer, but not my style

chocolate, bread, nuts, alcohol, soy sauce, woody, Spiciness.
Colour is murky brown, medium head.
Flavour is rich, but weirdly spicy.
Deep ruby color with a big thick head.  A little lacing.  Aroma of fruit.  A little sweet.  Creamy mouth with a mild taste.  Some sugary notes.  A little grass as well.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 En 2010 jul√∂l. Det b√§sta jul√∂let hittills i √•r. Mycket kraftiga och juliga smaker. Balanserat och behagligt. Eftersmak som ger mersmak.

Smakade √§ven 2009 som f√•r 3,8 po√§ng
Smakade √§ven 2012 som f√•r 3,8 po√§ng

2nd bottle of my 4th July American evening (2008).

Poured into a Westmalle trappist chalice.

Deep Ruby red, dull until held up to the light, then you could really appreciate the clearness and true shades of the colour. A light tan head soon faded away to a thin scummy covering.

Smell of dark chocolate, roasted malts and coffee beans, all blending together to produce an interesting and well balance aroma.

Tasted of slightly burnt brown sugar on toast, with plums on top. Coffee appears in the aftertaste and the alcohol could be felt lerking in the background all the time. The hops also come into play, along with a peat fire type of infusion.

Impressed and a lot better than the Yeti I opened the evening with (in my opinion).

From notes: Poured ruby red-amber, with a small, thin tan head.  Aroma of piney hops and some spice, with a note of caramel malt in the background.  Medium-thick, with a slight oilyness.  Flavor of piney hops up front, giving way to a note of spice, followed by caramel malt in the finish.  Nice lingering, spicy hop nte.

Originally reviewed: 3/3/09. Pours a deep mahogany with a massive bubbling tan head that spills all over my counter. Great retention paired with beautiful sticky lacing. Smells of nuts, some coffee, vanilla, and malt. Decent. 

Mouthfeel is weak and watery. For a "big" beer like this, it is disappointing. Decent carbonation, just too slick. Taste is a big wallop of nuttiness that I was not expecting. Some of the bitter walnut aftertaste in there. I¬ím also getting some raisin, booze, and slight spiciness. Not bad. I¬ím glad I got this, and I¬íd most likely get it again next winter, but I wouldn¬ít drink more than 1 at a time.

355 ml bottle. Oulu, Finland.
Dark copper colour with small off-white head.
Malt, caramel, toffee, wood and malty sweetness in aroma. 
Dark malt, cocoa, some hoppy bitterness, mild roastedness and woody dryness.
Nice winter warmer.



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark amber with a low head. Strong aroma is sweet malts and toffee. Flavor is slightly roasted malts, caramel, alcohol and hops. Simply superb.
Bottle. Pours dark amber with a small head. Aroma raisins, hops. Very sweet american hop style taste. Not Bad.

This beer tastes like Earl Grey or Chamomile tea.  Aroma is hoppy and somewhat minty and it pours a beautiful coppery ruby body with a decent tan head.  Taste is spicy, malty and hoppy with hints of peppermint, pine and those herby tastes in hot, black teas.  Can¬ít stop sipping this beer to sift through it.

35,5 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori, BBE 05.10.2012
Aroma is fruity and sweet with malt, some cocoa and hints of resin. Flavour has american hops, some cocoa, vanilla and fruits. Surprisingly thin palate. American DIPA meets old ale and the results are nice but a bit too sweet for me. The sweetness doesn¬ít disturb as much as it does with some DIPAs.

355 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori, Tampere.
Pours clear dark red color with minimal head. Aroma has lots of dark ripe fruits like plums and raisins, caramel malts and mild toffee and wood notes. Flavour of plums, raisins, sweet caramel, malts, mild grassy notes and maybe some pumpkin. Sweet palate with a long sweetish and fruity finish. Complex but still quite balanced brew.
5426

bottle [email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ pours. ruby reddish with a small head. aroma of plums, little sourness. sweet taste with plums and currants. quite smooth

My dad says that they used to drink this style of ale when he was younger as it was cheap and it got them pissed. This is no longer the case...this was a beautiful taste that made me wanting more...am i being turned away from porters and stouts? More Barley wines for me.

355 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori, Tampere. BBE 15.10.2012.
Pours a deep amber colour with a small white head. Aroma of overly sweet caramel malts, syrup and some wood notes. Flavour of sweet caramel malts, wood, syrup, nuts and some licorice. Some bitterness too. Full bodied, slick mouthfeel and a sweet, warming, dry malty finish. Pretty much a barley wine with too much sweetness. Nothing new nor unique.
Solid clear brown in color. Nice solid malts but minus points for bitterness left on tongue.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 A dark, reddish brown beer with a quite big and blond head. Aroma is interesting, caramelly maltyness, some roastiness and citrusfruits, wood and interesting herbs. Taste is similar than aroma, slightly caramell, some roastiness, sweet and sour, woodyness, some pine forest. Smooth, medium bodied, low carbonation. Interesting and unique beer, enjoyable.

Dark brown beer with ruby highlights. Has a nice creamy dark beige head and good lace. There is a sweet nutty malt aroma with hints of chocolate and coffee and a bit of spicey hops in the background. The flavor starts with a bit of sweet chocolate on the tip of the tongue. Followed by a roasted malt bitterness.

On tap at Brew Kettle in Strongsville, poured into pint glass

a: pours a dark amber, some what translucent

s: roasted malt, coffee, and chocolate

t: roasted malts, coffee, and chocolate, light hop profile.

m&d: medium body with decent carbonation

old malt right up the nose, slight flora hoppyness,dark amber color, white head, foamy hops dance lightly on the tongue, then the maltness of this brew takes over, overpoering the hops, overall good winter warmer beer, really intense will have to try again with older bottle!
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text:
355ml bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki
BBE 15-Oct-2012
Pours dark red with a tiny white head. Aroma of syrup, caramel, toffee and malts. Taste is sweet with notes of caramel, toffee, brown sugar and malts. Finish has notes of glue and sweet fruits. Okay, but way too sweet for my taste

(bottle). Nice red brown complexion with tan head.  Strong malt flavor with hop balance and alcohol.  Nice winter warmer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12/30/11 On tap at the Great Divide tasting room in Denver. Nice red color. Good sweet head. Nice malt taste. Could not notice any alcohol. Tasty beer
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Feb 9, 2012 tap at TH Tap.  Translucent reddish brown pour with some head.  Malt, hoppy, and spice aroma.  Taste is similar to aroma with a slight bitter finish.  Just a bit thin though.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 Perfect aroma, chocolate is strong.  Nice head... maintains well.   Nice malty wonderfullness.  Slight bitter, doesn¬ít seem sweet... seems perfect.   Which makes it perfect on the palet.  Overall this is one of the jewels i¬íve found as of late!  It does build in bitter overtime, which I wish it didn¬ít.  Depends on the bottle though.  Some almost seem like a nice hot chocolate yet cold with alchol.  Pretty amazing.

Thanks Bob, for turning 10 years worth of MacGregors beer points into this beer for me.  And it was a beauty, and a nice beer to enjoy for a while.  Goblet, reddish, nice lasting head and retention, really attractive looking.  Rich nose, much of which I could not put my finger on.  Toffee, roasted malt, earth.  Palate is a bit hot, caramel and malt, towards a barley wine but nuttier.  Finishes nice.
Out of a bottle. Beautiful chestnut with khaki head. Flavor is caramel and dark fruits. Medium-full chewy mouthfeel. Rustic complex flavor.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle is deep reddish brown with thin off white head, aroma brings nice notes of raisins, dark fruits, some caramelized sugars, some slightly bitter grass and earthy type hops as well in there, hints of slight nuttiness as well.  Taste is a blend of sweet vanilla, nuts, dark fruits and some grass and earth to round it out, finishing a bit sweet but the alcohol balances it out without being an overwhelming force.  Nicely done, great sipper brew.
Dark brown with a hint of red beer and has  light brown head.  Mild aroma that gives off a chocolate coffee smell.  Taste mostly a caramel chocolate sweetness that finishes with a little hop.
enjoyed this at The Dabbler yesterday.  A great beer with solid mouthfeel and perfect for a chilly night.
Nice medium brown hue. Flavor of melon and caramel with a nice syrupy resin mouthfeel and tropical hoppy finish.

Draft. The appearance was a dark brown almost hazelnut, and the aroma was burnt hoppiness, a touch of resin. The palate was a little over medium bodied with a crisp biting texture, and the taste was fantastically hoppy, bitter, cutting alcohol aftertaste. Good stuff.

1 finger beige head, amber body. Nose: Hay, lichi, passion fruit, oranges and resin. Aroma: Seville orange, lichi, passion fruit, citrus, resin, caramel and the slighest hint of dark chocolate. Semi-long bitter aftertaste.

This beer has no head and looks (and kind of feels) like cherrywood varnish. It has a roasted caramel malt aroma...which struggles to overcome the booze odor. It tastes like malty and syrupy sweet and has an abrupt finish. It is chalky and harsh on the palate, (bring it I say, 4/5)but unfortunately there is too much riding on the ABV. Not like English old ales.

Beautiful ruby red color with about a finger of tan head. Aroma is very sweet with some caramel figginess to it. Taste is also very sweet and fruity but light and warm. Lots of flavors in this beer and they are very well balanced. I can¬ít stop drinking it because I can pick out something different with each sip. This is an extremely satisfying beer for both the flavors and the warmth. This is a very unique and delicious winter seasonal.

Pours dark caramel with light medium tan head, light lacing. Aroma of burnt caramel and spice.  Smooth, light bitter middle and lingering finish.  Medium body and strong burnt caramel flavor.  Pretty good beer.

Pours a good looking clear ruby amber with a modest head and light lacing.  The taste is right up front, with dried dark fruit mixed with roasted malt and touches of chocolate, followed by a finish with a slow alcohol warmth.  Very little bittering and nearly free of carbonation, this is a very good brew, but not great.

From a 12oz bottle (updated look not like the one in the picture) into a pint glass.  Pours a beautiful ruby red.... man, that is nice!  About an inch of sticky white head and lots of lacing.  Aroma is kind of vomity....I mean it, smells kinda like vomit.  Mouthfeel is very nice and rich without too much carbonation.  Taste is very hot and harsh.  Flavors of cinnamon, banana, berries, cheese, skunk, egg and dirt predominate.  Meh, I really didn¬ít like this one.  Alcohol flavor is too harsh and the rest of the flavors really didn¬ít make up for it.  Pass.

Den h√§r √∂len var mer intressant √§n den var god, men det inneb√§r inte att √∂len var d√•lig. Smaken √§r maltig och b√§r en ¬íengelsk¬í k√§nsla √∂ver sig, jag kan √§ven k√§nna en lite nyans av kaffe. Dessv√§rre g√•r alkoholen igenom ibland och det drar ner betyget.
Bottle - Oct 10, 2011. Full, malty taste with a lively feel in the mouth. Rich aroma, very well balanced. Very nice winter ale - one of my favorites this season.

One of my favorite beers. Rich and flavorful like a stout, without being anywhere near as thick and syrupy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours hazy red-orange with a small, creamy, light brown head. Toffee, dried fruits, caramel, honey and herbs on the nose. Brown sugar sweet, roasted bitter, caramel and notes of nuts and spices in the mouth. Full bodied and smooth to drink. Recommended!

Poured on draft into a pint glass. Aroma is aged and malty with a pleasant musty character to it. Appearance is a dark brown/amber with a creamy beige to khaki colored head that dissipated quickly. Taste is musty with notes of cherry, chocolate, and coffee. Relatively thick on the tongue and leaving a toasty aftertaste with a bit of alcohol warmth.

Served on draft.

Arrived with a clear dark brown with a small tan head.

Smells of dark chocolate and roasted malt. There is a heavy roast presence with this one and not much hop aroma.

The taste is very roasty with hints of chocolate and caramel. There is decent bitterness but with little hop flavor.

Overall a pretty good beer that I would be interested in trying agian.

Strong and serious beer.
Nice aromas and flavors from caramel.
A very nice winter ale

Bottle pours clear toffee, beige head fades quickly to a skin but stays.  Aroma is sweet malty toffee, caramel candy, dried red fruits, biscuits, hint of chocolate, aroma is overall very subdued yet pleasant.  Taste is same as aroma, tons of biscuit, some chocolate and leather too.  Body is full and sticky, low low carbonation, sweet spicy warming finish.  Overall, very sweet but nicely balanced.  Surprisingly drinkable for the abv.
2011 edition is excellent.  poors a fine head, but the aroma is absolutely entincing.  the malts are complex and full - i look forward to cellaring this for a few years to see how it develops.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2012 Re-rated:
Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear deep red with a small beige/white head. Hoppy and roasty aroma with alcohol, grapes, raisin. resin, caramel present as well  A bit sweet with a bitterness that increases just enoguh to round off the sweetness and hints of alcohol. Medium body and mildly carbonated,  has a warm feeling to it that makes it perfect to enjoy after the dinner.
Chocolatey nutty aroma. Almost red in color. A malty hoppy taste. This beer is awesome for the winter.

Bottle. The pour was a clear medium to dark brown with an average sized (1-2 finger) creamy light brown head that stuck around for a little while leaving behind a slight residue which clung to the sides of the glass creating some fair lacing.

The aroma was of a toasted caramel malt, a mild touch of resin hops and a sweet earthy yeast with notes of dark fruit and molasses.

The taste started out moderately sweet and a bit malty with a hint of caramel and molasses then worked itself into a more distinct bitter sour flavor with a definite note of dark fruit and a strong alcohol presence at the end. The dark fruit flavor was left lingering on the taste buds for a nice long while after the swallow, along with an slight alcohol warming sensation.

Mouthfeel was just about medium in body with a almost syrupy texture and a mild carbonation.

Overall an impressive tasting brew, one with nice sweet fruit flavor that was off set nicely by the slight alcohol tinge it possessed.
Caramel, toast, resin, really nice winter ale.  Has a sleight sweetness, but not too much
Has been my favorit christmas beer on Systembolaget the last couple of years. Perfect before or after dinner.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours with a thick beige head that settles but never leaves the beer. Nice dark mahogany colour, slightly hazy. Aroma is malty sweet with good backing from hops. Taste is classic old ale american style, very similar to Old Flaghorn of Anchor, caramell and hops. All very balanced. A great beer.
Bottle. Light tan head, on a mahogany murky body. Toffee and dark malt plus fruitiness. Rich, light woodiness, cocoa, and toffee. Medium to heavier body.

A deep red pour with an orange-white head. The aroma is strong with smoke, fruits and hints of alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, wood and fruit. Finishes sweet, hoppy and oily in texture.

Pours with minimal head, ruby colored hue, reminiscent of wine. Yeast and ripe fruit immediately discerned. Alcohol pleasantly noticeable. A very nice example of the old ale style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Guthrie¬ís in Chicago.  A hazy brown color. Creamy, sweet, malty, medium-to-full bodied, and a durable flavor from beginning to end. Besides the maltiness, caramel/brown sugar stood out as the front flavor.

Aroma of butterscotch, caramel and malty goodness.  Pours thick and brown with a bready head.  Tastes amazing!  Bitter pine hops with notes of butter, caramel, and toasted malt.  A hearty beer and an easy and exciting sip.

Nose is wood chip, heavy cane sugar, warm mellow alcohol, weak sour orange peel, feel Is mediumbroad, carb is medium, taste is cane sugar, cream, oak, licorice, mediumheavy cough syrup, late mediumweak hops note

Bottle from systembolaget, Christmas beer tasting. Helsingborg, November 2011. 

Big aromas of American hops, dried peaches and apricots, sweet caramel malts. Smooth and soft body with a big malt focused taste. Caramels and hops, some toffee and overripe fruits are prominent flavours. Creamy and rich but a tad to sweet for me.

Aroma - Spicy, hoppy
Appearance - Dark Clear Amber-Brown, Light Head
Taste - A mild, smooth, holiday beer; a little sweet and a little malt
Palate - smooth finish, no bitterness
Overall - Doesn¬ít taste as strong as the ABV indicates; a nice spicy holiday brew.  I would prefer it just a little more malty.  Great for once in a while but not an everyday beer.

First off, why did I only accidentally stumble onto this at a party.  This is one hell of a beer.  Pours a brown/red with little head.  Nose is a nutty toffee, heavy sweetness and some alcohol  Taste is big roasted malts,  a big thick caramelly smoothness, chocolate and creamy dark booze.  To be honest if you said this was barrel aged, I would not be surprised.

Pours dark brown, fairly clear, with a small off-white to tan head. Nose is caramel malt, nuts earth and winter spices. Taste has a bit of alcohol to it, but is dominated by malty sweetness. There¬ís a slight bitterness from the start to the finish to balance it up, but the sweet malt dominates - as it should. Body is very rich and full, with slight carbonation. A great seasonal.

pours a copper color with aroma of malt and alcohol.  Taste is strong alcohol with a honey aftertaste.  Strong alcohol is very present at first but dissipates quickly after.  A good beer for the style but not very drinkable.
Bottle. Deep dark black color. Smells of malt, nuts and honey. Taste is malty with a hoppy afterbite. AbV is far from present. Very easy and nice drinking. Very good.

winter spices,caramel and chocolate dominate the aroma unusual and very inviting..wine like red color with a bit of brown thin beige head some lacing...caramel,ginger,nutmeg, raisin,slightly peppery spice and piny hops again very unusual but real good..warm and smooth on the palate slightly dry aftertaste..overall this is the first time ive tried it but its instantly one of my favorite winter seasonals

Poured a dark and clear reddish-brown color with a medium-sized off-white creamy head.  Aroma is quite roasted with nuts and some brown sugar.  A bit earthy too.  Taste is very thick and flavorful with lots of chocolate and caramel.  Some molasses and dark fruit.  Finish is very roasted with nuts and some bitter spruce flavors.  Overall very nice.  A perfect winter beer.
Pours chestnut brown, moderate head, average aroma. Taste is pretty much sweet malt, and very little of interest about it. Not a bad beer, but just fairly uninteresting. Not one to try again.

12oz bottle from Pinocchio¬ís. Pours a dark ruby color with an off white head. Aroma is malty, cereal, toffee. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, toffee, a little chocolate, and a little pine hops, with a hoppy, bitter finish.
On tap at the WOB.  Clear dark amber pour with an off white head.  Notes of chocolate, dark malts, and toffee..

It pours a rich brown red color that is clear and has a brownish cream head. The smell is musty with an overall sweet aroma throughout. It tastes of rich malts, caramel, chocolate and a bit of a bitterness at the end.

The overall mouthfeel is smooth and leaves a rich flavor in your mouth that is not overwhelming. This is a great beer and is very well balanced.
UPDATED: DEC 10, 2011 Bottle, pours brown with small head. Aroma is caramel, bread, some hops. Taste is medium bitter and little sweet. Good
It poured a dark brown color with a small head. The aroma was of caramel, chocolate, and some piney hops. The taste was of malt dominance, but a very balanced beer.  A very good Old Ale.
(bottle) medium dark brown with tan head. Malt/whisky aroma. Flavor is slightly sweetish malt, hints of whisky, alcohol.
dark pour, light head.  malty and slightly nutty with a little toffee sweetness. a little bit of alcohol warming.  very robust and strong.  excellent winter brew.

Fairly sweet - somewhere between generously sweet and too much. Goes down nicely, slickly, although there is a suggestion of malt liquor at the finish which becomes a negative. Overall it was slightly enjoyable, losing a little luster as the bottle empties.

Draft at World of Beer (Land O Lakes).  Pours a dark mohagany brown with a tan foamed head.  Solid sheet of lacing along the side of the glass.  Aroma has loads of roasted malt with molasses and a touch of tobacco.  Flavor is rather sweet up front with the hop bitterness coming in the finish.  Lasting aftertaste.

Kastanjef√§rgad √∂l med beige skum. Rik p√• dofter av maltighet, alkohol, rostade toner och n√∂tter. Allt detta finns √§ven i smaken. Alkoholen √§r inte p√• n√•got s√§tt p√•tr√§ngande men ger en v√§rmande k√§nsla.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2012 Bottle. Ruby colour with a beige head. Sweet toffe aroma with some hops. Caramel and chocolate flavour, but too strong alcohol taste.

12oz bottle. Clear red color, with a sort of burgundy hue to it. Very minimal head, a bit of lace. I¬ím a big fan of this stuff... First time I had it, I got a six-pack for a Halloween party because I thought it was a great value for the ABV. It¬ís very drinkable, even straight from the bottle... Ended that night with three of these, couldn¬ít finish the fourth and it was a tragedy having to pour it out the morning after, because I enjoyed these thoroughly. Luckily I still have 2 left over. Enjoying it now with a clear head and in an actual glass, it¬ís just as malty and robust as I remember... The label picks the two most perfect words to describe it. Dark fruit aroma, molasses, spice, a bit of chocolate. Good amount of hops balance the malt out perfectly and add a super-pleasant crisp english-style bitterness that works perfectly. It¬ís an old ale that IPA-lovers will appreciate. Great palate - lighter, crisp carbonation, not syrupy or oily at all (some appreciated dryness actually). Nice, long aftertaste to savor, making this a great sipper (although I can attest to it¬ís drinkability for when the need arises). Great Divide impresses me again.

355 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on November 15. Only 39 days till Christmas so I felt it was time for a hors d¬íoeuvre. Pours deep copper with a small light brown head that dissipates almost immediately. Smell is sweet and refreshing with dried sweet fruits and spices. Taste is slightly dry and rather bitter with caramel, sweet fruits, resin and cloves. Finish is dry and slightly bitter. It¬ís quite vinous and very enjoyable.
Pours ruby with small tan head, aroma of malt and some hops, hard to grasp. Taste is caramel malt, some floral hops and a bit of dark fruits, good but I¬íve had better from this brewer

Pours a ruby brown with a small tan head.  aroma is of roasted malts, carmel, dark fruits, alchool, and some floral hops.  flavor is nice and malty with alot of roasted malt, dark fruit, carmel, toffee, and some wood, rum notes, and some booze in the finnish.  has  a full body with a rich creamy mouthfeel and a bitter, slighty boozey finnish.  overall, a very good winter beer.

I would enjoy this far more if I was slowing freezing to death in the Yukon, or even Chicago. Warm inside my house, it is a tad too sweet (caramel, dark chocolate) and taste strongly of alcohol. I do, however, appreciate the balance of hops. Pours a beautiful coffee brown, lighter than you might expect

My first old ale. Dark copper/mahogany colored brew with a big, off-white head. Aromas of caramel, nuttiness, and assorted spices/hops. Taste is of lots of caramel booziness, nutty flavors, some raisins, and bitter pine hops. Very malty, ends on a bittersweet hop profile. Leathery, earthy beer. A sipper, this was a decent introduction to old ales, but I was expecting something more memorable.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2011 Pours amber with a tan head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma is toasty, raisin, caramel and nuttyness.  Taste is sweet with some boozyness.  Smooth with alcohol well hidden.  Overall this is an excellent brew, it is great on a chilly night.

Bottle. Pours a deep dark amber and mahogany color with creamy beige head. The aroma is all dark fruits and caramel malt with some bittersweet chocolate and rum in the mix. The flavor starts out with toffee, dates, black cherry and raisins followed by some chocolate, prune and woody alcohol notes toward the end. Also a very mild and bitter herbal hops presence in the background. The mouthfeel is thick and creamy with medium-level carbonation. The overall flavor is aggressively malty and complex with a strong shot of alcohol holding it all together. Definitely a good choice for a cold winter night.
Pour is a dirty copper with a decent white lacy head. Smell is coffee acorns. Taste is roasted toffee caramel raisons.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2011 Fresh batch. Beautiful ruby red color. Has a big nutty character that is very reminiscent of a stout, with the normal big malt and slight banana of an old ale. Balanced so it isn¬ít too sweet. I¬íd be interested what age would do to this. Not a whole lot of depth though. I get bored of this beer pretty quickly and have trouble finishing.

Draft at Great Divide. Pours a deep reddish brown with a fluffy hit of head. Nose is pretty robust. Treacle and molasses, some dark fruits and candy come through. Plenty of prune/date notes as well. Pretty clean overall, light ethanol noted. On taste, full and round, there is a distinct sweetness, but it is dried out by the bitterness level. Pretty solid beer overall.

12oz bottle.
Reddish brown pour with a small amount of head.  Aromas of grassy hops, caramel and roasted malts - flavor is very malty with some vanilla and a decent hop bite.

The beer was served in an Imperial Pint.

Ar- This is a very well toasted and even slightly roasted malty beer treat. The aromas of caramel, toffee via with a hint of almost cocoa notes. The hops kick up a floral notes for me. The alcohol is definately in the nose. Perhaps I am just wishing but this beer smells like a bourbon treatment would be supreme. 

Ap- The body of the beer is coppery red coloration. The head is a thin coppery tinged biege coloration. The head resolves quickly but lots of foam marks the beers rapid passage from my glass.

T- Very nice pine infused toasted nutty caramel malty treat. The alcohol is a bit hot in the flavor but I am liking it. Again tempted to give this a tiny bourbon hit. 

P- The body of the beer is full and the carbonation level is low but works well with the beers character. The alcohol is a bit hot and brings the palate down from a 4. I am wondering what a few months to a year would do to this beer?

O- The enjoyment factor is high for this malty treat. If the alcohol was tamed a little this beer would be a big treat. I am curious enough to get a sixer and set back for a cellar nap.

Bottle - Pours clear rosy mahogany with a thin foamy tan head. Nutty, roasted grain, honey, and sharp oak. Tons of malt. Taste is big, big malt, buttery bread, oak, caramel, some baking spices, and a long, warm malty finish. Big robust nutty malt comes back strong on the long finish, along with some smooth grassy hops. A little thinner than I expected, but smooth and creamy. Really nice, and I can see why this does well in the cellar.

(Bottle 2011) Darker copper color. Nice clarity. Appropriate carbonation; tan head dissipates quickly. Aroma of slight biscuit, dried fruit, and burnt caramel (pleasantly so). Caramel malt in the taste with nice bittering finish which lingers. I¬ím laying a few of these down - a little leather and dusty malt on this beer would bring the interest way up. A great winter beer - pairs perfectly with snow an not leaving the house.

Pours a dark amber with tan head.  Head disappeared quickly leaving a thin ring around the glass.  I¬ím a bit stuff so I suspect I¬ím not appreciating all the nuance of the aroma, but did detect dark fruit and malty notes.  Rich malty taste with with stone fruit, coffee, burnt toast and rich roasty flavors.  Dry finish with nice bitterness from the dry hopping.  No small beer at 8.1 ABV, Very enjoyable.

Definitely the best all-around altbier (old beer) that I have savored thus far! I can definitely see pouring up a few bottles of this brew into my combat-mug and watching the Rangers win the World Series!! Insanely aromatic and full of complex flavors; it¬ís just a good ol¬í strong beer! So stop reading and go get ya some of this fantastic beer!!

12oz bottle poured dark brown with a light brown head that dissipates quickly. the aroma is of malt deep roasted, coffee and hops. the roasted malt flavor comes out as you drink and the coffee undertones. the dry hop is very apparant. just wish it was a little less for this beer would be very good. not that it isnt...but it is a little overpowering for this style.

Bottle: beautiful amber color with a short lived, small tan head.  My nose is greeted with toffee, and caramel, and some nuttiness.  The flavors are a great balance of toffee and a thick sweetness, that¬ís capped off by some bitterness at the end.  Great beer, I am ashamed that I haven¬ít had it before today.
Pours a beautiful amber with a good head. Very aromatic and lively on the palate. Has that big Great Divide flavor that is quite good. A recommended winter seasonal.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2013 Raisins and dark fruit on the nose along with what seems like a big alcohol presence. Clear, deep amber with a faint and fleeting tan head.
